final_review: I gave this drive to someone as a gift and theyve been using it for backups for  months without issueMy review is based on another unit of this drive which I bought for myself some months later  Ive been using it as my primary desktop OSprograms drive since  so its about  months now  There have been no problems thus far  Its really quite a bargain for desktop use if TB is all you needThe actual capacity of this drive is GB Thats an old marketing trick which can be blamed for the pointless redefinition of all our real long established data measurements with those silly i characters I wont dwell on it any further but GB is the true capacity when measured in base  as all data is correctly measuredThis TB Blue drive uses a single TB platter spinning at rpm  There are  heads each side is GBA single platter design is usually better for reliability than having multiple smaller platters because there are fewer points of failure the assembly is lighter the motor doesnt have to work as hard and less heat is generatedSingle platter drives will also tend to be quieter but due to my configuration I cant judge the noise levelThere has been much discussion and testing among users in online forums including WDs forum which repeatedly show that the TB Blue and TB Black perform the same It appears the only benefit of the TB Black is a longer warranty Some Blacks are faster than this drive but the TB model is notCompared to a Green the Blue is faster owing to its faster rotation speed  The Green drives also have an intellipark feature which causes them to keep parking the heads after a few seconds of inactivity  This can cause laggy response and extra wear  I dislike that design  I believe power management functions should be left under the control of the operating system which can account for user preferences and what is happening in the rest of the system  Hardcoding this behavior into the drive is ridiculous in my opinion  The Blue behaves the way I prefer  it does not use intellipark it stays ready to roll until directed otherwise through power management commands from the OSI wish they were making the Blue series in larger sizes  it seems this TB is the end of the line  I dont care for the Greens and the Blacks are more expensivePartitionSector AlignmentPlease be aware that like most modern drives this drive uses KB sectors also known as advanced format  If you are using Windows  Windows XP or older as I am dont let Windows handle the partitioning of this drive  This is even an issue on unpatched versions of Vista and Windows   These older versions of Windows will believe that the physical sectors are  bytes when in reality they are KB  As a result the partitions will not be aligned with the physical sectors  It will still work but performance will be reducedWindows Server  and Windows XP and older do not have any update to fix this but its not a problem as long as you do the partitioning with a suitable rd party utility  I think Western Digital offers a tool for this but Ive never tried it  Once the partitions are set its fine to let Windows format themFor my Windows XP install I used a recent version of GParted to partition the drive  GParted can be downloaded and burned to a bootable CD or installed to a USB flash drive  Just use the option to align your partitions on MB boundaries  This is the easy way to ensure they are aligned correctly for the best performance  Then boot your WinXP install disc and let it format the partition that you already created  It sounds harder than it is its a minor hassle but its simpleIf you ever change the partitions once again use GParted or a similar utility that handles alignment for modern hard disks  Dont use the builtin XP partitioning  But again once the partitions are created its fine to let Windows format themThe builtin partitioning is fixed in Windows According to Microsoft it is fixed in Windows  after installing Service Pack   you would need to have that service pack before partitioning the drive not afterAgain according to Microsoft it is also fixed in Windows Vista after installing update MS KB   I assume this is automatically installed for people who use automatic updates but I dont know that for a fact  This wont do you any good if youre doing a fresh install and your install disc predates the required updateThe partition alignment detail Ive described above is an issue you will encounter with any recent hard drive its not unique to this model  If you ignore it performance will be affected but it will still work  You may see Seagate drives implying that they are immune from this but in reality they are not  All modern advanced format drives of any brand will perform better if sectors are properly aligned  But its not a big deal  just use a modern partitioning utility and then youre setI just tested this drive using Roadkils Disk Speed on Windows XP bit  Ill cut out all the variables and just give the linear transfer results with large block sizes  My drive has a few partitions and there are lots of files on it so this might affect resultsFirst partition first GB  MBsec linear readrd partition physical location range is from GB  MBsec linear readLast GB is unpartitioned so I cant test that rangeI dont think the random access test is useful because my partitioning greatly influences the resultTheres a test mode for the whole physical disk but its results are too inconsistentThis drive is a great bargain if you just need a simple inexpensive well performing rpm hard disk  I was tempted to try a Seagate SSHD but I couldnt justify the cost compared to this  If I was shopping today Id look carefully at the HGST and Toshiba offerings as well but from the WD side this is my pick for a general purpose TB desktop driveUpdate It is now   This drive is in my desktop PC used daily and still works fineSome months ago I ran a benchmark on this drive using the linux utility gnomedisks  The random access performance measured out to a ms average This is mediocre but expected from a quiet drive Screenshot is attached It also shows the transfer rate across the disk read test only I didnt test writes

Worth every cent  I had been putting off buying a much larger stroage drive Finally got one now I can store much more for much longer get bulk files off of my work drives etc  This drive is a storage drive not a performace drive I use it to store files movies etc For gaming and the such I either use my SSD or my WD BLACK hard Drive  I am glad I picked this up I have not had a single issue with it and it has freed me up to do more with my other drives as I no longer have to have them filled up with large files I rarely use Below are the color codes for WD drives I do not know how different their performance are from one to another or if it is all marketing but here it isBLUE  Solid performance and reliability for everyday computingBLACK  Maximum performance for power computingRED  Increased workloads and reliabilityPURPLE  Designed for Surveillance DVR storageGOLD  WD Gold HDD is designed for Servers

I had recently purchased an external hard drive case that is usb  and I used an old Seagate TB Barracuda I had laying around to expand my sons hard drive on his xbox one Unfortunately the old seagate didnt stand a chanceIt worked for a few weeks and then I got the dreaded TICK TICK TICK noisehard drive platter was ruinedNot sure what happened Anyway I already had the  enclosure with fan so I opted to get another bare hard drive to install in there I have always had Seagates and to be honest this is the first that has failed me But it is indeed  years old I installed the new WD in the enclosure in less than  minutes and plugged it in I formatted it for xbox one and installed his games there We played a few games and everything works like a charm With the GB transfer rate I dont think its going to be an issue Granted this is day one I write a ton of reviews so I will be back to let you know if there is any changes in the hard drivePRICE For what I have invested in the hard drive and the fan cooled enclosure it is still cheaper than buying an external hard drive Not by much as they are getting cheaper but someINCLUDED You should know all you are getting is the hard driveThere is nothing else in the box No instructions or cables or plugs or whatever you need to use for your  project This can be installed in a desktop PC that takes a  hard drive or a  hard drive enclosure  If you are unsure on how to install this please google itRemember you live in a video era and you have unlimited knowledge at your fingertipsEASE OF USE Simple PLug and Play You will need to format it for the xbox one Put it in a  USB  enclosure and plug it in Then follow the onscreen prompts Its as easy as clicking a buttonLike I said before I have always been a  Seagate fan because that is the first brand I got  years ago and it lasted this long This is the first WD I have had so I am keeping my fingers crossed on this one I do hope this review helps someone out there If you have any questions please feel free to ask If you found my review helpful let me know Lets keep making better buying decisions together Thank you for reading and as always Be Safe  Happy Shopping

this review is for the WD Blue TB SATA  Gbs  RPM MB Cache  Inch Desktop Hard Drive WDEZEX I purchased TWO of these drives delivered together for two custom computer builds I attempted to install Windows  on the first one and upon the first restart the computer went straight to the CHKDSK mode and it indicated bad sectors I restarted again and got a BSODSo OK no problem I installed the other new Hard Drive and the Windows  program loaded and ran just fine but I discovered that the other new Drive is beyond just being noisy on a Cold Start it actually screeches a little but it does quiet down to a more tolerable level in a minute or two when it warms up and so I told my customer about the problem and apologized for the inconvenience when he came to pick up his new computer and told him to bring it back for Hard Drive replacement if it did not quiet down after  some break in time He was not upset but all in all this is a pretty disappointing product experience The Good News is that Amazon makes the return process very easy a new Hard Drive was shipped out and the Bad one was returned in the box it came in with a printed return label from my copy machine Five Stars for Amazon customer service and only Two stars for the Sorry performance of the Hard Drives These drives are the very first drives from Western Digital that I ever had a problem with and unlike previous drives that I purchased from WD I must say that they actually feel very cheap and light My first Red Flag with these two Drives was that neither New Drive needed to be initialized by windows before they could be formatted and that is the first time that has ever happened with a Brand New Hard Drive traditionally brand new hard drives need to be initialized before they can be Formatted and used and that made me suspicious that these May Not in fact be brand new I dont know but maybe something has changed in the Manufacturing process and perhaps all new hard drives come preinitialized now but if thats true that is new information to me I will update this post if there is any problem with the replacement drive that I receive But what I can say with absolute certainty that I will ONLY buy the Higher quality Western Digital RE Enterprise Hard Drives with the Yellow Label from now on they are worth the extra  at current prices just to make sure that I dont have to apologize to another customer for giving him a newly built computer with a subpar Hard drive inside

There are more than enough reviews of this disk as an internal drive My interest however was to use it as an external USB drive and that is what this review focuses onThe  WD Blue TB hard disk drive WDC WDEZEXWNA has attractive properties for storage purposes a formatted capacity of  GiB out of its nominal  GiB usually described by manufacturers as  GB a  rpm rotation rate a  MB cache a SATA III interface with a GBs speed and SMART monitoringIt is not the top of the line of Western Digital SATAs at least in terms of the length of their limited warranty  years for the WD Blue versus  years for the Black although there are claims of not too different benchmarks but because of its relatively low price it has a drive value index similar to the top nonSSDs  This makes the WD Blue TB a good choice as an external USB drive for the storage of media or data in particular incremental backups especially when disk writes caching is enabled since top performance values are unrealistic for serving as a guide for external USB devices where performance is primarily dictated by the USB specs and manufacturing complianceThe figure below shows results of a free benchmark app in wide use Crystal DiskMark for the Blue TB used as an external USB storage drive left table and to provide some perspective to these values for an internal SSD with a good performance as a system drive right table  the latter which was partitioned into two logical drives has a capacity of  GB and both devices are quite comparable in the fraction of used capacity ca  which is important since performance declines as a drive gets full  The first line in both tables are the averages of sequential  reads and  writes with multiple queues and threads for a relatively large data block this measures how quickly large files eg backups or multimedia can be read from or written to the drive  The second line are the averages of random  reads and  writes with multiple queues and threads for a small block this measures how quickly many small files eg when copying large app folders or loading programs during operating system startup can be read from or written to the drive  The third and fourth lines mirror the above two but using only a single queue and thread  The lower performance of the Blue TB is only due in part to USB transfer issues published data indicate that if used as an internal drive the values in the left table would have increased by less than two fold  Nevertheless its performance is quite appropriate for external storageI mounted the WD Blue TB vertically in a dualbay USB docking station and it is typically quiet but for some clicks when it starts spinning A negative finding is its temperature after many hours of use compared with a  WD Blue GB disk that warms up to about C F in the second bay of the open docking station the Blue TB gets hotter in the range of C  Temperature is often claimed to affect drive reliability but see Failure Trends in a Large Disk Drive Population by Pinheiro and coworkers  so I put close to the station a small USB fan with an adjustable speed set to a low value to keep it quiet which brings the Blue TB temperature back to the belowC range

I have a veritable rainbow of WD drives red green blue between my PC Drobo and newly built NAS and they are all real workhorses  I have yet to have any of them fail or misbehave even after  years  I know certain colors are best suited for certain applications but I find the blue drives to be the best bang for the buck and most versatile  I bought this most recent TB blue to install in an old PC that I turned into a Plex media serverhome made NAS  Ive been wanting to have a dedicated media server for some time and finally had the chance to do it but needed more storage space  The PC I had has a TB hard drive that I wanted to remain dedicated to running software and store all of my movies tv shows documentaries and kiddie crap haha on its own drive  I installed this the other day and loaded all my visual media on it I keep pictures and music on yet another drive and I still have room to spare  I immediately connected the new server to Plex through my Roku  and watched a movie p on the TV while streaming another to my phone and had no trouble whatsoever  I know a lot of the buffering problems stem from inadequate CPU and mine is good but just in case youre wondering these blue drives have no trouble streaming content from when youve got adequate transcoding power in your machine  A lot of people would tell you you need red drives but old blue does just fine in my experience and is so much cheaperFor those of you who are new to installing new hard drives its a piece of cake but just be aware that this drive does not come with any cables or mounting hardware so youll need to be sure you have your own SATA cable and an available power source cable as well as screws or whatever you need to mount it in your case  Also for the newbies you cant just plug and use youll need to go in to your drive manager and nameformat it before you can use it  This is also very very easy to do and only takes a few minutes and then youre ready to goI dont use these WD drives to boot and run software anymore its all about SSDs for that now  buy one it will change your life but I use these drives to hold and back up all of my data for me and I love them  You really cant get more storage and a more reliable drive for a better price than this  And dont be freaked out because the picture shows the inside of the hard disk this is a fully enclosed drive see pics  Hope this helps  Happy computing  I did NOT receive this for free or at a discount

It is my professional opinion based on decades of building upgrading and repairing PCs that Western Digital makes the most reliable hard drives in the marketplace I believe this TB hard drive from Western Digital continues their tradition of cool and quiet performance and outstanding reliability and this particular offering is in the sweet spot of cost per unit of storage where you get the most bang for your buckI replaced two TB hard drives with this single TB unit to double my capacity and reduce complexity my two TB drives were configured as a RAID stripe set which increases transfer speed but also doubles the risk of failure The upgrade was easy I was able to quickly move my files to the new drive and it is humming along nicely now at just over  capacityI use this to store all of my files I have an SSD for my mainsystem drive which stores the OS and applications and loads everything lightning fast I was concerned initially about the slower RPM rotation speed of this drive but it has not been a problem at all When I was transferring files to the new drive I was getting between MBsec which is great for a mechanical hard driveThe drive is warm to the touch but not hot I fully expect this drive to perform for years troublefree just like the Western Digital drives it replaced and the Western Digital drives that they replaced before them

Working in IT Ive come across many different hard drive vendors and Western Digital by far destroys the competition Ive seen Western Digital hard drives going strong for easily  years with no problems whatsoever These blues are fast quiet and of course economical When one of my clients needs a hard drive upgrade or when theirs goes out I drop in one of these and Im on my wayIf by some strange stroke of bad luck and one of these drives goes bad I simply head over to Western Digital support quickly get an RMA request filed and presto I have a new driveNow brands like SeagateIm lucky to get  years out of them If theres one brand I hate its them if a drive is dead unresponsive has errors makes noises runs hot theres a  chance its a Seagate Id rather use a potato than a Seagate Western Digital hands down

On a  Sony Vaio desktop I decided to take advantage of the free Microsoft upgrade to Windows  just to make sure I had another valid Windows  license in the box so to speak Because the Vaio is still in good shape I thought I might as well upgrade its hard drive as the GB exTivo drive I had in there was getting a bit noisy so I ordered this dirt cheap terabyte Western Digital drive Long story short Windows likes large hard disks it makes the operating system run faster due to the virtual memory it likes and at rpm and GBs SATA this is a pretty quick drive The install was painless I cloned the existing drive to the new drive updated Windows which became Windows  Pro and despite the aging Pentium the Vaio has a new lease on life and is impressively peppy The drive isnt just fast it is virtually noiseless and runs cool SMART tells me Back in the box should I need it

I never thought Id be leaving a notsogood review for a Western Digital hard drive  Ive favored WD drives for many years  A hard drive has to work reliably or its completely useless  So I dont give super high marks for the device just doing its job  The drive is working  The gripe I have is the drive isnt very well balanced  My computer now makes a droning sound when the new drive spins up and I can feel vibration on the outside of the case  Its yet to be seen if this will impact the drives life span  Ive never had a WD drive soundfeel like this  I hope WD isnt starting to let their quality control slip  Historically Western Digital is one of the safest  most reliable drives to buy  It will be nice when highcapacity solid state is cheap enough that spinning drives are no longer a consideration

I bought two of these in April of  They have been running in my desktop since then The one of the two that does get heavier use has just failed It is now getting bad sectors popping up all over the place The other seems like it is doing OK but I will probably replace it as well Three years is a bit on the low side for durability While it certainly outlasted its warranty I would have hoped it would have lasted at least  years With over  years in desktop support I have seen the majority of systems last on the floor with no hardware failures for  years Since it did last more than three years a three star rating seems fair This drive is certainly decent just dont expect it to last especially under moderately heavy use

I installed this to replace my failing OEM hard drive  I am an old retired guy with extensive training and experience with electronics but my area of expertise was radio satellite and microwave communications not computers  Installation and cloning the new drive using the WD Acronis software downloaded free from the WD website was easy and straightforward  The only problem I had was of my own making I didnt run Check Disk on my old drive before attempting to clone the new one  My old drive was failing and I knew that from the beginning  I had to stop and go back run Check Disk and let it repair the bad sectors it found  Once I did that the cloning went smoothly and much quicker than I expected  I then removed the old drive and put everything back together  It is working like a new computer now  By the way my system is using Windows  Home Edition

I purchased this as a secondary drive for my Windows  Pro machine It does its job of additional storage However prospective buyers should understand the difference between MBR and GPT when configuring this something I did not do MBR Master Boot Record is the older drive standard that most machines have used GPT GUID Partition Table is a newer standard to replace this These are not to  be confused with file formats such as FAT NTFS or ext MBR only supports up to TB disk space for a drive while GPT does not have this limitationI chose MBR when setting up my drive only to find later that Windows was only seeing TB of disk space while GB of space remained unallocated I could not change this in Windows Disk Management There is a way to change this via Windows Command Prompt However users unfamiliar with the Command Prompt should not use this method The safer option is to download a free trial of partition software to rebuild the entire disk as GPT If you do not want to do this you can create an Ubuntu Live CD and run GParted to format the unallocated disk space into an NTFS drive Windows will see this as a separate drive and assign it its own letter this is called a logical partition as both drives reside within one physical disk

Ive long been a fan of Western Digital hard drives and this drive continues that tradition My computer has an external hard drive slot to just plug a drive in I use this WD Blue to plug into that slot when I want to do backupsOnce its plugged in you just need to set it up once in Windows Drive Manager and youre good to go  Disclaimer I own a small number of shares of stock in Western Digital Not enough shares to influence my review I own the stock because the drives are good not vice versa

I work in the IT industry and have built many computers NASs etc  My go to drive at this point is Western Digital  Ive got several Red drives in a NAS in my home several WDs drives in other PCs and a few laptop drives in external readers  all without issueWith that said  this drive has been pretty good so far  Im using it as a data drive to my primary SSD it runs nonessential  nonspeed dependent apps such as Office etc  Ran Crystal Disk and getting great speeds  check my photo

Failed just after the  day mark  Hard drive was working fine then a windows pop up stated that hard drive couldnt be accessed because of errors  Ran disk check windows rebooted and now cant access the drive as it comes up unknown device and it will not initialize as it says there is not enough space  Looks like the control board failed  Now stuck as WD does not accept OEM devices for warranty and waiting for information from seller on if it can be returned and exchanged  Moved from WD green devices because of their habit to fail roughly every couple years and my first blue drive that I buy does thisNotation edit  Pay attention when ordering and what class of drive it is  If it is OEM WD does not warranty it  And Amazons return policy does not cover past  days  If going through a third party seller check their return policies  Many follow Amazons return policy as well  So on day  it is up to the seller  Ive bought  hard drives through amazon in the last  months  failed  good and  unknown  One current failure and is OEM   because of USPS delivering a box that looked like it had been through WW and decided to take an additional stroll through armadagon USPS replaced the contents of the box as it was their equipment that destroyed it without even having to test the drives and  worked nonOEM  Of course the one drive I currently have is OEM and it looks like it is going to be trouble getting it replaced  Amazon states in their return policy that it is up to  years on some electronic devices but will not let me start a return on this  Thinking of switching my hard drive purchases to another party with a more realistic hard drive return policy

Worked great on Lenovo Desktop From previous experience I knew I could add this SATA III Gbs  as a secondary disk drive Note it does NOT come with needed  mounting screws and does not come with any cables at allFor my desktop I needed a Y SATA power splitter cable to get another power line to this drive I also needed a blue SATA III data cable I had bought these cables on a previous occasion from Amazon when I knew I would be doing two of these installs  I had onhand the small probably metric approximately  inch long computer screws needed to fasten this to the empty available secondary drive bayI had added a secondary SATA drive once before to a different Lenovo desktop so the actual physical install procedure took me only  minutesYou then need to boot up and into Windows Then format it either as NTFS or FAT and choose partition type either MBR or GPT and do a full format which probably took an hour For now Ill use it for secondary storage If you plan on installing Win be sure to use GPT and not MBR partition type and use NTFS format

At home using a robust Internet connection Ive been spoiled to be able to watch streaming videos at times that are convenient for me  During my motorhome travels where reliable highspeed Internet connections are usually NOT available Ive depended upon satellite TV movie channels  Unfortunately the satellite movies have been scheduled at their convenience and not necessarily mine  The solution for me was a Digital Video Recorder DVRI bought this hard drive in combination with a Sabrent USB  SATA Inch Aluminum Hard Drive Enclosure ECGD so I could use it with the DishTV VIPK satellite receiver in my motorhome  The combination of those two items from Amazon  cost between  and  less than similar offerings on DishTVs Website  According to DishTV a TB hard drive will record  hours of video but they dont say if itll record that many hours in HDInstalling this hard drive into the Sabrent enclosure took no more than three minutes which I felt was time wellspent considering what I saved  After I plugged this enclosed hard drive into the satellite receivers USB port turned it on and had DishTV activate the hard drive which costs  it took about five minutes to format  Completing this installation Ive been able to automatically record movies from my satellite receiver and then play them back at a time when it is convenient for me to watchIn this DVR application I could not ask for better performance  I can set up the DVR to record movies automatically and have those movies waiting for me when its convenient for me to view them  The recordings are as clear and sharp as the original programming and play without pauses stuttering or glitches  Compared with buying a hard drive that was already in a housing with a power supply this combination costs less and provides flawless performance

This will store TB of porn That is way too much porn Dont you judge me This hard drive will smite other weaker hard drives making it the hardest of all drives It  also goes hard in the paint im not  percent sure what that means though probably some drug thing

I use this as an internal backup drive  I have the backup utility in Ubuntu Linux configured to make a nightly incremental backup at  AM which usually takes only a few minutes to sync with all changes made to my main hard drive during the previous day  I also make monthly uncompressed disk backups and keep the last three and I have an external hard drive version as well  Ill eventually get another network attached storage device and keep everything backed up on that RAID device  My working hard drive is a solid state drive SSD and that makes this workstation run MUCH faster  Use the SMART drive diagnostics in the Western Digital hard drive to monitor the age errors and remaining expected life of the drive and replace it before you start losing data  Hard drives are inexpensive  Your data is not  Choose a strategy to protect your data before your drive fails  Unfortunately most people seem to think hard drives last forever and they really miss their data when its gone

This drive provides value for the money Its not especially fast but my use case for it is bulk storage I have an SSD for things that need frequent and rapid accessYou may not want this to be your primary drive if your concern is performance However if you need a lot of storage at a very attractive price this is a good choiceInstallation was trivial Plug and play partition restore from backups I was replacing a failed drive done I have a dualboot LinuxWindows  installation and encountered no difficulty at allNo personal data as yet on longevity but Ive always had good luck with WD products in the past Still it goes without saying  do your backups

Purchased for installation in my fathers primary PC to replace an existing drive that was starting to fail The cloning process went smoothly which allowed us to forego a lengthy reinstall of OS applications and backed up data Unfortunately after  days the machine in which the drive was installed began to exhibit problems rebooting nightly windows popups complaining about being unable to save  write to files Doing a chkdsk x f r and rebooting claimed to correct filesystem problems but running the provided Data LifeGuard software for Windows detected bad sectors that it claimed it was unable to repair It recommended we contact WD support for assistanceI recognize that we happened to get one of the few bad drives in a batch but the warranty  replacement process as described on their site is frustrating Effectively the consumer is left without a functioning computer unless they invest additional money into another drive on which to copy their OS and data while the faulty product is shipped examined and repaired  replaced Given the cost of shipping and the low cost of the smaller drives its probably more cost effective to simply write it off Sadly the consumer is left with a bad taste in their mouths from the experience

From the previous reviews I was a little apprehensive about this purchase I bought the drive for an older HP Touchsmart computer This is the rd drive for that computer It came originally with a Seagate g drive that lasted about  months I was disappointed in the short duration of that drive but HP assured me that was the only brand and size of drive that would work in this particular computer So I was directed to a vendor in New York that could sell me another drive like the original Well that one lasted  months Then I started reading reviews of Seagate drives Apparently theyve been having some quality control issues in the past Hence my desire to purchase a different brand Since I really like the  Western Digital Passport external drives Ive purchased I decided to take a chance on this one Thanks to all who responded to my questions about whether it would work in this computer I also decided to upgrade to a TB drive instead of a g I am so glad I didThis drive came up immediately My full version of Windows  loaded on it very quickly And the drive is vVery quiet so far I know there are a few complaints about the noise but I havent experienced that at least yet It is so fast compared to the previous drives that were in the computer And it is pretty cool seeing how much free space i have on itI highly recommend this drive to anyone considering it What I learned is pretty much all  inch Sata drives will fit in and work in any computer calling for that size drive It worked well in my older HP allinone Touchsmart

This drive has served well so far  massive storage quiet stays cool when tested with Crystal Disk Info whats not to like  Install was as always a noneventIve had WD Seagate and other drives in the past ten years Ive been indulging in my computer hobby  Ive built my last three boxes from scratch and my current one is a monster I use for video and photo editing storing all the pics and videos from my nine security cameras and its also my media server feeding content via wifi to the Apple TV box attached to my home theater  There is one SSD and five large conventional hard drives in this box four of the five are Western Digital  There is also a drive plugin bay on the top of the box for temporary use of a drive my backup  Thats this drive  Why are so many of my drives WD drives  Fewer failures than the other brands and they give me no hassle ifwhen a drive fails within warranty  No sweat  RMA send me a drive I return the original to them  At least that doesnt happen often but as is the case with any mechanical device its not going to last forever  I just want it taken care of it it happens within warranty and WD does that for meNo Im not a Vine member  I paid full price for all those drives

The hard drive came packaged securely Installed it in the computer formatted it and it worked fine I did a full format not a quick format to test for bad sectors and then went to do a chkdisk on it and it told me I didnt have to because I guess it already did during the full format which took like ish hours by the way and it said there were no bad sectors Overall Id say this is a good purchaseI am glad I went with this drive over the WD Black saved a couple of dollars I was worried about the speed of the drive considering I only have an SSD in the system this would be for adding extra games to since my SSD was filled up quite fast No problems loads games just fine Couldnt be happier with this purchase Now I see why so many people choose this driveI guess Ill just come back and add a note to this review if the drive fails on me but Ive been putting it to the test filling it up with games adding files deleting files I think it will last

Worked for a year and then tanked not in BIOS or disk management  I even attempted to turn on Hot swap in my BIOS and is doesnt detect anything  I should have known better than to buy a WD blue as we have had thousands of these die at the hospital I work for  I decided to roll the dice and trust Amazons reviews  I was fooled  The high rating for this product comes from multiple products across multiple years and the drives are constantly being made by different manufacturers  Amazon needs to change their rating system  A WD TB SATA built in  is not the same as a WD  TB STA built in  and yet they are lumped into the same rating pool

WD Blue TB Desktop Hard Disk Drive   RPM SATA  Gbs MB Cache  Inch  WDEZEX ReviewThis was a replacement for another TB drive that lasted about  years Was the same as this but the green version This is much faster and seems to be doing the job It fit as it should in the computer and recognized as i needed toPro’s• Cheap• Fast so far• Fits as expectedCon’s• None so far but its a hard drive so who knowsConclusionIts a basic TB hard drive No frills or anything It doesnt glow red or make coffee for me in the morning but i am hoping that it wont stand me up either

This Hard Drive arrived defective Contacted Western Digital and they agreed to swap it out This was a brand new drive that formatted to  and died and I paid  to ship it back to them and they sent me a Recertified drive I asked for a new drive and spent at least a half hour of them telling me no I called Amazon and told them the entire situation and they sent me a new drive at no cost Turns out the Recertified drive was completely dead Not recognized for even a minute The replacement that Amazon sent works but is noisy I dont expect to buy Western Digital again no matter how low the price They showed I was not valued as a customer and benefited them self at my expense Amazon is the best and I appreciate them and how they have treated me over the years

This is a great basic hard drive Its a terabyte spins at  RPM and has a  Gbps SATA throughput To top it off its a great price per GB  sure there are drives at higher capacities with lower prices per GB but this is the sweetspot A thumb rule I use to calculate that how much does the next lower capacity cost In this case  GB sells at about  Add  and your capacity doubles to this  TB model Thats  increase in capacity for  increase in price Whenever a Hard drive capacity falls in this rule thats what I define as the budget sweetspotComing back to topic at hand The hard drive arrived in basic but very functional packaging with adequate protection And its working perfectly fine so it living proof that its all good in terms of packaging and handling I unpacked it and installed it into my desktop  a process that took about  minutes end to end I booted up the computer and voila the hard disk was seen Windows initialized it and in matter of seconds I was up an running with this shiny new storage bin for all my games movies and musicIve been a WD user for years after switching over from Seagate due to sheer number of RMAs I had to do with Seagate And once again I am super satisfied with this model Go for it its a great budget hard drive with the optimal capacity based on my formula above

if it failsBefore the facts there is GOOD NEWS and its listed at the bottom and the drive does work fine right now but  stars because Im worried ok it makes noises probably normal noises and it is really a cheap green drive so that worries me tooThe current factsIt vibrates it makes old and somewhat loud pc like noise head movement when playing games or when not playing games but transferring more than one file at same time downloading  or  games at once If it is doing multi file transfer but one after another instead of all at once then the head doesnt move much so no noise can be All hard drives fail eventually Its not a matter of if but when WD has a great warranty and the process is painless If the drive fails under warranty they will even do an advance replacement If the drive fails out of warranty they will offer a steep discount on a drive the same size or larger You cant go wrong with that I have built a lot of systems and overall the Western Digital drives have worked out better longer than other brands Ive tried I was looking for a  RPM drive because thats the sweet spot with spindle speed  RPM drives are nice but expensive and tend to run very hot  RPM drives are okay for laptops but not what I want in a desktop environment MB of cache also is a plus for me Unit was shipped incredibly fast arrived in perfect condition installed without any issues and represents the best value and performance for the money

Cant beat them for the money We use these as disposable forensic drives Each drive gets used once on most cases then stored in evidence or destroyed The  benefits are  sata  for speed and low price The Blue series is a great value as a forensic work driveVery inexpensive for what you get I remember paying  for my first  gig drive decades ago Weve come a long way to PCIE m drives

Every time I booted up my computer I couldnt get past the HP Logo for the computer would display a black screen I ran HP Diagnostics and I got  Hard Drive Short DST failures All this occurred after installing a new APU the A from AMD and thinking it was a damaged motherboard after thermal paste got on the CPU pins Praise Jesus it wasnt my motherboard I cleaned off the APU and all is wellMy Hitachi drive had signs of failure before my CPUinstallation fiasco for my computer would lock up at random times I could hear the Hard Drive spin for half a second before spinning again then again etc and this continued from  to  minutes before the computer was usableTHIS Hard Drive the WD Blue TB has been running fantastic so far Its quiet and very fast I would recommend

I bought this drive to replace an old WD Green Caviar drive of the same size that was starting to get bad sectors causing frequent freezeups and slow downs etc  I could tell from the SMART data that my old drive was on borrowed time I used free open source software to recover  of my data to this new drive SystemRescueCD and ddrescue  Let me tell you that the speed improvement was immediately noticeable with this WD Blue drive  The  RPM and  MB Cache make all the difference old WD Green was variable RPM and  MB Cache  Its extremely quiet when seeking and barely audible from  feet away  I am using this in my HTPC and its doing its job wonderfully so far  I would recommend this drive to anyone looking for a great value both in terms of price per terabyte and overall functional quality  You cant beat this drive at this price  These are my own opinions I was not given compensation for this review

This TB sic drive works exactly as expected and it is perfect for the purpose for which I bought itI would have bought the WD Black to get the longer warranty but in this case the warranty wasnt worth the price differenceI always buy WD because a they are ALWAYS exactly what I expect and they behave that way b in  years I have had ONE WD drive fail in the first  years of use and that was so long ago that it was a GB drive which failed ONLY after the machine it had been in literally burned up  The drive was moved to another machine and despite the burn marks on its case it did not fail for another  weeksI expect this drive to last for the  years for which I need it and I would buy it againWith WD the best surprise of all is that there are NO surprises  I would recommend this drive to friends and family

If youre looking for a hard drive for your Xbox One this is the one I would recommend through and through  Its surprisingly quiet and outperforms the Western Digital Black series in some areas  In fact I notice everything is faster running and installing to this drive over the stock one  The bang you get for your buck is awesome here folksIf you want more space I say go with the TB but eventually youll be playing musical chairs anyway  Considering you save  off the comparable Black models Blue is an underdog that you GOT to loveAs others have mentioned in their reviews the average read speeds are quite impressive with the TB WD Blue drives  The only thing it seems to struggle with is random access  Thats because they literally spin up after being idle  It sounds like a mini airplane  Actually its very quiet too  But if you listen close enough you might hear it  Not a big deal but fun to think aboutDo not try to fly this hard drive  It is NOT a vehicleXBOX ONE PEEPS  I recommend the Sabrent external hard drive enclosure  Make sure its the one that supports USB and SATA  It has a fan onoff button and you can hotswap hard drives  The latter I would not recommend due to potential data loss but its cool You can flip the lid and put another hard drive in  Really great if your gaming library is massive and you dont want to go through the process of redownloading stuff all over again  Believe me I understand  I have the worst ISP ever and they charge for data usage  The name sounds like Dom Fast Yup wink

This hard drive is quiet and seems quick I thought I received a bad drive when it arrived I plugged it into my hard drive docking station to test it and I did not hear a thing A moment later an icon popped up on my monitor screen asking me what I would like to do with this drive I was shocked I did not even hear the motor spin up I use this hard drive along side my SSD for large programs and files and it works great I would definitely recommend WD In the past  years I have had multiple Seagate drives die on me but all of my WD drives are still going I have  WD drives on a media server that have been running for  years with no issues I have never shut it off except to dust it and I had to replace the motherboard and memory a few years back but the WD drives keep going I am getting concerned about their age they have tens of thousands of hours on them but they keep chugging along  Seagate hard drives died within  years in the same server All I can say is I definitely got my moneys worth out of my WD drives Thanks Western Digital

I put this drive in the second bay of my older desktop computer as the data drive after upgrading the boot drive to an SSD since I couldnt afford an SSD large enough to hold all of my photos and music files  It is quiet cool and faster than I expected with transfer speeds of  MBsecond about twice as fast as the noisy circa Seagate it replaced I have had it running for six months with no issues

I was torn between the Blue Red and Blacks Having always unhesitatingly gone for the WD Black this time I already had SSD storage to provide fast immediate storage Did I really need to spend the extra cash on the WD Black line over the Blue I decided to do some researchFirst the RPM speeds Red spin slower somewhere around  while the Blues and Blacks do rpm This makes sense The Reds are meant to go in NAS enclosures which means possibly a few  disks in close proximity The slower speeds generate less heat  which matters more since there are multiple drives and not just a single drive  which helps improve disk conditions and longevity The Blues and Blacks are meant to go in Desktops The Blacks have a  year warranty whereas these Blue only have a  year warranty  year with the Retail kitThe WD Black perform better than the WD Blue line but not by much If you dont already have an SSD and only need one main drive pick a WD Black To be honest the main difference is the warranties previously mentioned The extra cost of the Black ensures you wont have to buy another drive for  extra years Personally I figured I could afford to spend the cost of another WD Blue should it fail after  years so the extra warranty period for the WD Black was not a factor for meThe last thing which helped me pick the Blue line was a Western Digital document which specifically stated that both the Black and Blue drives are fine in Desktop RAID setups  Intel RST LSI HBAs etc  they just arent recommended for NASEnterprise RAID setups I was worried about TLER lack there of and the shorter warranty period but when I realized they could both be put in a RAID setup the difference between these drives became a nonfactorThat said I havent yet turned my drives into a RAID array and am using them in JBOD   Just a Bunch of Disks  mode meaning Im using them much as most people would I can honestly say there isnt a noticeable difference on the user experience side of things on the difference between the WD Black and the WD Blue I highly doubt a user that claims he could blindly tell the difference between the drives

I have had good experiences using Western Digital hard drives This is the second one of these I have bought this year and I would recommend them to anyoneI did have a problem but it was not caused by the drive Western Digitals support is what keeps me going back to them for drives My problem was that after I installed an operating system and rebooted the drive began reporting its size as MB instead of TBI will caution you not to use any drive of TB or larger as a boot drive on Gigabyte motherboards with Qflash There appears to be a glitch that corrupts the volume size information of large hard drivesEven though my new drive is now unusable because of the motherboard in my computer they will replace it under warranty I spent almost  hours on the phone with a rd level technician located in California while we tried different things to repair this drive He was professional and courteousI am very happy with them so I have to let everyone know

Improve PC PerformancePair a larger capacity drive with an SSD to give your desktop a performance and storage boost The SSD maximizes speed of data access while the WD Blue drive stores up to TB of movies games files applications and moreUpgrade and Backup with EaseWD hard drives come with free access to WD Acronis True Image Our downloadable software quickly copies all your existing data to your new drive – without reinstalling your operating system Backup and restore functions make it easy to save and retrieve your personal dataPlan for the FutureWith better technology comes bigger storage needs Cameras that record ultrahigh definition video at K resolution and  frames per second require a ton of storage Handling all that media is a snap with our TB driveNoTouch Ramp Load TechnologySafely positions the recording head off the disk surface to protect your dataData LifeGuardAdvanced algorithms monitor your drive continuously so it stays in optimum healthIntelliSeekCalculates optimum seek speeds to lower power consumption noise and vibration

I purchased this drive to add more space to a NAS server I was using so I didnt expect much out of drive itself especially concerning speed but overall I was happy with the purchase as the drive performs and pass all SMART checks WD makes some of the most reliable drives in my opinion on the marked so expect the drive to last if not outlast the device you are planning on install this into The packing includes the drive and manual as well as warranty information but not much else so if you are planning on cloning an existing drive to this one I would recommend a USB SATA cable and Paragon Hard Disk Manager to clone the OS or files onto your new drive I will point out that this is a  RPM drive so its marginally faster than your standard  RPM drive and performs well for an OS drive if you arent too concerned with speed as for long term storage this drive provides great transfer speeds and performs above expectation I would recommend this drive to anyone looking to expand storage space or just looking to replace a smaller drive on an existing machine

I have had difficulties of late with Seagate Drives going bad  Our Dell Desktop came with a STA TB drive and through diagnostics was able to determine the problems we were experiencing with hanging up was due the hard drive going bad  I have never had a Western Digital drive crash on me since starting my computing days back in the mideighties with the old MFM technology so I determined that the replacement would be a WD drive  I am very impressed with the price and speed of delivery of this WD Blue drive  Also the unit was well packaged to avoid any damage box within a box and spacers to keep unit from moving  As a Prime member the twoday shipping would have been free but Amazon offered a nextday delivery option for only  so I took it  The unit arrived the next day before  PM and I was able to get it up and running in no time  Using my ClickFree C unit I was able to restore the entire image of the old drive back onto the new Western Digital drive and return the computer to its original fast working order  While I had the computer opened I blew out all the dust removed and reinstalled the memory chips and other cards and connectors to insure the contacts were solidly connected  I also replaced the coin type battery on the motherboard and installed a new in card reader  Using the WD Diagnostics software free download from WD website I ran the new drive through all the tests and its is humming like a well honed Swiss timepiece I am a happy camper

This kitten has been using this TB drive for several months and likes it lots  It has bunches of storage space and is reasonably fast without generating a lot of heat or making a lot of noise  This kitty used this one to upgrade the GB drive in its Dell Optiplex  mini desktop and has been very happy with how well its worked  It was a little reluctant about getting a nonSSD as an OS drive but this kitten is happy it didnt have to spend a bucket of money on a lot of storage space  Its not as fast as a SSD but mew can get lots of storage space at an affordable price if mew dont mind waiting  Oh and sequential data transfer is pretty fast anyhow  Is just that random seek takes a little longer

This is the second WD Blue Ive purchased Works as advertized My suggestion would be to run any drive non stop for a few days Hard drives usually fail in the first several days of operation If you dont have a problem after the first week or so of running it constantly you should be good There is no magic hard drive They all have their issues over time If youve had good luck with a particular brand stick with it until you do have a problem Also save yourself a lot of grief and remember to backup your drives regularly Just do it You never know when a drive might fail And youll thank yourself for it in the end I have a storage disc installed in my computer I store all my important files there and keep my applications on the main startup drive I also have a hot swap bay for changing hard drives for more backup options And if I run into trouble with my startup drive I can just pop in another All this was the result of losing years worth of pictures files and memories A little planning will keep you happy for years to come no matter what your hard drive decides to do on its own

This hard drive model is a good balance between performance and a great price for those looking to upgrade from smaller capacity drives This is my second or third purchase of this particular model and it is performing to my expectationsso far But there are other hard drive models  made by both Western Digital and Seagate  that are sold by third party sellers on Amazons site and fulfilled by Amazon This one is an exception that is sold and shipped directly by Amazon But people need to beware of the unethical practice of some of these sellers due to quality defects and questionable warranty issues They are actually selling used drives that are pulled from working servers and workstations  and are repackaged and resold at suspiciously low prices as new Amazon is fully aware of this practice by these scammers but is doing nothing about them Always do your due diligence by testing ALL hard drives purchased here using tools available on Western Digital and Seagate websites Check for warranties to avoid getting scammed and IMMEDIATELY return any that do not meet stated performance and warranty standards

The hard drive on my iMac went belly up last year so I went to researching the best hard drive to replace it with There is a TON of information out there and a lot of warnings so when i read that someone had used this one to do the exact same thing i was doing i went ahead and pulled the trigger on it So far its been fantastic The noise level of a hard drive has never bothered me so I didnt factor that into my decision but im not able to hear this one at all I have two external hard drives that are much louder so they probably drown out the sound that this makes once installed i initiated my time machine restore and once it was done i was back up and running no problems There are plenty of reviews on the more technical specifics of this hard drive but like i said in my searches to find a replacement for my iMac there is so much information out there lots that is even contradictory that i wanted to put this here for someone else that was in my position

I purchased this hard drive to add to an older Dell desktop computer  The drive is easy to install and works well for my purposes data storage  Be aware that this particular product package contains the hard drive only  There are no instructions SATA cable or screws included for the installation  If you are simply replacing an existing hard drive this should not be an issue  But if you are adding this as a second hard drive you will need to purchase those additional parts  The ones I purchased were StarTech Replacement PC Mounting Screws Long Standoff   Pack SCREW and Monoprice inch SATA Gbps Cable wLocking Latch  Black which worked perfectly  If you are not familiar with how to install a hard drive there are numerous videos and instructions available online that are just a Google search away

I may update thisIve had this drive for about   years and have been using it as storage in my PC for movies music backup of OS drive So the drive gets moderate use no executables infrequent writing etc Before the days of SSDs I only used WD and have had drives that have outlasted multiple computers with pretty rough use In fact I still have an old  GB that has lived through at least  computers and has run XP Vista  and still works it is just too small and slow for any purpose at the moment So I have come to expect a pretty high quality product from WD Now that WD has all sorts of color coded drives I am wondering if the baseline Blue model is garbage and the higher end Black drives are just the quality of their old drives at a new premium priceNow this drive hasnt failedyet I started getting a variety of warnings from Windows and at start up that the drive has gone bad This may just be a false detection and might just need a check I did try a check through windows but my computer became barely responsive so I am going to go another route However I am waiting on a new drive to back up his one in case I end up frying the whole thingSo like I said pending results of me backing up this drive and checking it for a fix I might update this review For all I know these warnings are just the equivalent to a cars check engine light coming on at certain intervals to get you to come into the dealership and spend more money But if it actually is crapping out really think less than  years is pretty mediocre for the life of a WD HDD

I bought this to upgrade my PC which came with WD Blue  GB  I cloned my previous internal drive to this one using WDs Acronis program using the new TB as an external drive with a SATAIDE to USB  cord while leaving the  gb hard drive inside  I swapped the new  TB hard drive in and it had no trouble booting up right into Windows   I did need to downloadupdate drivers and then my PC required a reboot  Its working perfectly  Everything is exactly as it was on the old drive but now I have access to much more storageIf youre looking at this to upgrade from SATA II SATA III is twice as fast and it will probably result in a noticeable improvement to your PCs performanceIts worth noting that if youre adding this as a nd hard drive it does not come with any cables but there are plenty of options on Amazon that are inexpensiveFor people who arent experienced working inside a computer adding or exchanging a hard drive is quick and simple  Just make sure you read your owners manual and take appropriate safety precautions

Yeah this was a nice grab I needed the extra drive space and this was just what I needed at the price I found real affordable Install was quick and easy The drive does need to be initialized so that your system will recognise the new space available and I did stall for a bit trying to find out how to do that It turned out to be quite easyFor those who need the assist with initializing Click the Start Orb  rightclick on Computer  select Manage  under Storage select Disk Management  rightclick in the grey area of the unknown drive and select Initialize  pat yourself on the back and then format the drive as you desire

Over the years I have bought almost every brand of HHD on the market  I keep coming back to Western Digital because they are quality drives and maintain excellent data integrity  Even the lowend WD Blue TB SATA  Gbs  RPM MB Cache  Inch Desktop Hard Drive WDEZEX is a very good choice for the average user like me  Its  PRM makes data retrieval quick and the MB cache keeps frequently used data instantly available  Playback of movies and audio is seamless  Its vast storage capacity allows me to keep many years of pictures archived and ready to view instantly  For my money this is the best desktop HDD for the average computer user

I am a Network EngineerSystems Designer so I go through a ton of Hard drives in builds and my work in generalThis is the best all around hard drive made in my honest opinionHere is why FastIs it as fast as the WD Black version  Not quite but when you take the total performance and not select read times it matches up well  It is not noticeably slower  only with benchmarks on specific results  Ive replaced many Black drives with this drive for reason number  Quiet  Quiet  Quiet  This is a big deal these days with many of my builds  People dont want computers they can hear and with current technology there is no reason you should hear your computer sitting next to you even with the top of the line cutting edge overclocked CPUs GPUs etcNow SSDs are practical now in price but not practical for large Data drives  So the best option for now  is to run a GB SSD Get Intel its worth the extra money and then Platter Drives for your Backup Data Video etc  This is the primary use of the Blue WD Drive hereFor a Data drive in my case  However this can be used as a primary and ONLY drive in a computer system quite well and is quite fast dont misunderstand meIt is reliable from my own experience it has a lower fail rate than the Blacks  The platters are in a better layoutdesign And again its quiet  It is inaudible  so if building a system for quietness  This is your drive  Under  for a terrabyte you cant beat itMust buy

Fast installed easily XP service pack  installed flawlessly  THEN malware attacked when trying to get IE  working properlyMalwarebytes  free software download removed the malware from the WD  TB diskIE  worked so badly that we were forced to switch to FirefoxInstalling a new hard drive is easier than trying to get malware off an old diskDesktop now boots fast compared to old drive infected with unwanted hard or impossible to remove softwareOld SATA drive now used as secondary driveSearch for WD TB SATA XP installation for tutorial on WD  TB disk and XP installationLeo Notenboom adds  Malwarebytes I throw Malwarebytes Antimalware into a classification by itself Its not really an antivirus tool per se In their forums youll often see the support staff recommending antivirus tools to install alongside Malwarebytes But I cant really call it an antispyware tool either  Whats important is that it continues to have a very good track record of removing troublesome malware that other packages sometimes miss  Malwarebytes AntiMalware comes in two versions free and pay The free version is a fully functional standalone manual scanner I often recommend it as an additional tool when removing malware or when malware is suspect The paid version adds realtime scanning and scheduled scanning and updates

WD Blue is the Drive for YouWith over years in the communications and IT life I can strongly recommend the Western Digital Caviar Blue series internal hard drives I am now twice retired but I still build my own systems and also serve as the TIC Technician InCharge and as the system builder for my familySuitability To Task I use the Western Digital Caviar Blue hard drives as the Boot Drive and Primary  Active Partition This includes the Operating System  In our case Windows  Ultimate Bit  I have  WD Blue drives booting my network now  I bought the first WD Blue drives years ago give or take a month or two  This purchase makes my fifth th in the WD Blue line The first ones are now over years old with very heavy use as primary boot partition and Windows  Ultimate Bit installation drives on my  PC HomeOffice NetworkWD Blue  TB Desktop Hard Drive  Inch  RPM SATA  Gbs  MB Cache  WDEZEXWith the initial  GB Blue Drives I only made one partition for OS  Critical files and applications Note I actually said Applications as I am not cool enough to say apps  With the new reviewed  TB WD Blue hard drives I am making a  MB Boot Partition  Active  OS Windows Bit drive and a second  MB Files partition Windows and your applications will have better performance on a smaller partition as the OS does not have the burden of reading a large partition for each readwrite search  index actionI use these drives to store and serve over  TB of Movies and over  thousand MP Audio Files Movies  Music All Purchased Legally Of Course as well as thousands of other files for fun and for archive of documents and general correspondence I also archive all the familys digital photography Our network uses TVersity Media Server Pro and my X Box  to watch movies and listen to music in the great roomI started with the GB Blue drives and am in the process of upgrading to the  TB drives  None of the  GB drives has had a failure or a problem They run fast stay cool Are whisper quiet and very durableIn the same year period that the WD Blues have been booting and running my systems I have lost  three Samsung drives purchased at the same time and  two Seagate drives  The Seagate and the Samsung drives did not get as much use and yet they died hot noisy and way too soon  At the time the Samsung and the Seagate drives were a tick cheaper  They now rest in the bottom of a land fill and I would never recommend them for any use except as a blunt instrumentColour Confusion  WD WDFBLUE For most applications the WD Blue is drive for You As stated aboveGREEN Even though I am a treehuger at heart WD Greens are not to be seen  A good green idea or at least a hippy marketing idea but WD Greens have a much lower MTBF with thousands of reported problems and a very high datalossBLACK Black is Beautiful but these drives are over priced and overkill and typically over hot for most users The technical specification and performance characteristics are so subtle that most users will not notice any difference in Black  Blue You do get the SuperGeek WD Black bragging rightsThe year Black Drives warranty is nice but it is cheaper with the BlueBlue Note you can by Blue with an Extended Warranty and have the same year warranty for less moneyConclusion WD Blue is the Drive for You

Nothing earthshattering to report which is a good thing This drive was recognized immediately by my system and it serves its intended purpose well  data backupThis drive is not  RPMs and as such is not ideally suited for video editing backups and general tasking  storage is what this drive handles bestIf your budget permits pick up a couple to have on hand for redundant data backupThis is a solid drive for the money  highly recommended

I dont have the numbers in front of me right now but I ran some tests on my hard drive after it was installed to verify that this drive would actually perform as well as the passmark tests said it did Passmark btw is software that tests hardware across many computers and compiles the results to see how well different pieces of hardware perform Anyway this particular hard drive outperformed almost all other hard drives other than the solid state drives of course and was far less expensive than its competitors I was very pleased to find out that it performed just as well as passmark claimed it did from other testersAs to stability since day  this drive has given me no problems Beyond that I have not tested power consumption or heat dissipation Im not that much of an enthusiast I just know it was relatively inexpensive and performed right up there with the best According to passmark the WD Velociraptor only performed about  higher than this drive yet costs four times as much This drive is a real steal for the quality youre getting Besides its got a  year warranty

This kitten liked this hard drive  It works great in its Dell Optiplex  desktop PC as the primary drive  Its quiet and although its not competitive with SSDs in terms of performance its quick enough to make Windows  responsive and very usable  The price for the capacity is really hard to argue with so if mew need lots of storage space and dont wanna pay bunches of money a TB Western Digital desktop hard drive is a really good choice

Recently built a computer and only put an SSD in it because I had an external drive Well the drive was very old and started to corrupt the files on it needing a reliable cheap replacement I had heard nothing but great things about the WD Blue TB HDD It does its job and gives so much value for the price and capacity And it was very easy to install All in all a great product and I will be looking to WD for all of my storage needs from now on

Bought these for a RAID array to run Windows  Absolutely no complaints they are running flawlessly night and day just like WDs have always done for me If you need dependable drives at a reasonable price these get the job done For truly mission critical builds I have used the WD Black or Purple drives with great success  Really get long life out of them running  before ever having any issues Unbeatable for the price  Thats just my opinion but Ive got more than a few of these blues that are well over a year and a half running nonstop day and night still going strong  Hope you have as much success with them as I have

Using in a PC as an application drive the main OS is on an SSD  Price was right and this unit had good reviews so I pulled the trigger  so far the unit has been performing well and meets my needs  I have had reasonable luck with WD in the past however I have noticed higher failure rates on their drives in the last couple years and some of the larger sized green models require modifying the firmware to keep them from parking the heads too frequently which causes undue wear on the drive  In any case I have been using this drive for awhile now and its been solid so I will give it good marks  I will update this review if anything changes

Bought this drive to replace an older GB drive that gave me the click of death due to a bad power supply which I also replaced  I have to say for  purchased in February  this is one of the best drives out there  Is it the fastest No  Is it the largest No  But TB is all the space I need for now so its big enough  It supports SATA Gbps speeds which is nice because my system can boot in a few seconds  The drive came in an OEM box which means only the drive in an anti static bag  There are no cables drivers or directions included  This generally wont be a problem for new system builds since the cables usually come with the motherboard  But if youre upgrading an old system to SATA or dont have any cables youll need to buy some separately
Would recommend A very nice seller Keep up the great work man

This is a great nd drive for my wifes desktop  The item arrives as a stand alone bare drive  There is not CD no sata or power cables included  just a drive and nothing else  It did not take long for me to get it plugged in the the PC and hooked up  The BIOS recognized the drive just fine and although it needed to be mounted I use Acronis software there were no issues getting it up and runningIt is now a backup clone drive that I will reimage once a month  Cheap insurance for ifwhen the primary drive fails or we ever run into a software glitch

My Dell with RAID redundant G drives started hiccuping and burping and was deciding it didnt want to boot Usually that points to two areas  failing power supply   failing drives  I tried the easy fix first and replaced the power supply but to no avail I decided to purchase  of these  TB drives and replace the Degraded drives Degraded is the status that XP was reporting upon boot up I had the foresight to purchase a Western Digital Passport Ultra TB Portable External Hard drive and copied EVERYTHING to the drive using the WD utilities provided on the drive Installed the new drives Installed XP on the new drive Retrieved all pertinent files And baddabing I was up and running with T of disk space

RevANo problems WinXP I used it as an external backup HD via USBBasically happy  I was concerned because I have had problems with WD AF and Windows XPMy only problem was my own Remembering how to find format for a new drive WinXP HD was use for an external backup via USB enclosure box see belowStart Control panel Administrative Tools Computer Management Disk Management Disk  NOT drive C if for external backup drive Rightclick select for the following Disk  Initialize drive  I may have forgot some details then Partition drive select basic format check that its not labeled as drive C unless this is for your computer main HD it will erase every thing Now the HD ready for useUSB Enclosure usedMediasonic ProBox  SATA Hard Drive Enclosure  USB  SuperSpeed KSUhttpwwwamazoncomgpproductBDUJCGood luck

I use this as an internal backup drive  I have the backup utility in Ubuntu Linux configured to make a nightly incremental backup at  AM which usually takes only a few minutes to sync with all changes made to my main hard drive during the previous day  I also make monthly uncompressed disk backups and keep the last three and I have an external hard drive version as well  Ill eventually get another network attached storage device and keep everything backed up on that RAID device  My working hard drive is a solid state drive SSD and that makes this workstation run MUCH faster  Use the SMART drive diagnostics in the Western Digital hard drive to monitor the age errors and remaining expected life of the drive and replace it before you start losing data  Hard drives are inexpensive  Your data is not  Choose a strategy to protect your data before your drive fails  Unfortunately most people seem to think hard drives last forever and they really miss their data when its gone

stars because the drive I received was used either a return or a refurb Item came in on time I installed drive and saw it was already partitioned on the t mark most likely because someone used it in a bios computer Ok I thought maybe its proactive on the mfg part to split it so I decided to run a recovery scan and lo and behold there were many files recoverable Ive already notified the seller JusTrade about this as according to the ad page this is not a usedrefurb drive it has a  year warranty  refurbsused do not have warranty or at the most its  months I paid for a new drive with full warranty and I expect it to be new

This drive has served well so far  massive storage quiet stays cool when tested with Crystal Disk Info whats not to like  Install was as always a noneventIve had WD Seagate and other drives in the past ten years Ive been indulging in my computer hobby  Ive built my last three boxes from scratch and my current one is a monster I use for video and photo editing storing all the pics and videos from my nine security cameras and its also my media server feeding content via wifi to the Apple TV box attached to my home theater  There is one SSD and five large conventional hard drives in this box four of the five are Western Digital  There is also a drive plugin bay on the top of the box for temporary use of a drive my backup  Thats this drive  Why are so many of my drives WD drives  Fewer failures than the other brands and they give me no hassle ifwhen a drive fails within warranty  No sweat  RMA send me a drive I return the original to them  At least that doesnt happen often but as is the case with any mechanical device its not going to last forever  I just want it taken care of it it happens within warranty and WD does that for meNo Im not a Vine member  I paid full price for all those drives

The hard drive on my iMac went belly up last year so I went to researching the best hard drive to replace it with There is a TON of information out there and a lot of warnings so when i read that someone had used this one to do the exact same thing i was doing i went ahead and pulled the trigger on it So far its been fantastic The noise level of a hard drive has never bothered me so I didnt factor that into my decision but im not able to hear this one at all I have two external hard drives that are much louder so they probably drown out the sound that this makes once installed i initiated my time machine restore and once it was done i was back up and running no problems There are plenty of reviews on the more technical specifics of this hard drive but like i said in my searches to find a replacement for my iMac there is so much information out there lots that is even contradictory that i wanted to put this here for someone else that was in my position

This is the second WD Blue Ive purchased Works as advertized My suggestion would be to run any drive non stop for a few days Hard drives usually fail in the first several days of operation If you dont have a problem after the first week or so of running it constantly you should be good There is no magic hard drive They all have their issues over time If youve had good luck with a particular brand stick with it until you do have a problem Also save yourself a lot of grief and remember to backup your drives regularly Just do it You never know when a drive might fail And youll thank yourself for it in the end I have a storage disc installed in my computer I store all my important files there and keep my applications on the main startup drive I also have a hot swap bay for changing hard drives for more backup options And if I run into trouble with my startup drive I can just pop in another All this was the result of losing years worth of pictures files and memories A little planning will keep you happy for years to come no matter what your hard drive decides to do on its own

Decades of being top dog WDs Blue is still the best HDD on the market and while its reliable and you can have massive storage for cheap be wary that HDD storage is quickly becoming obsolete Invest in an SSD and use HDD for mass storage of infrequently accessed data like music or movies but in a few years both HDDs and SATA storage in general will likely be replaced as SSD solutions become equally affordable but infinitely faster especially with M
