If youre looking for a hard drive for your Xbox One this is the one I would recommend through and through  Its surprisingly quiet and outperforms the Western Digital Black series in some areas  In fact I notice everything is faster running and installing to this drive over the stock one  The bang you get for your buck is awesome here folksIf you want more space I say go with the TB but eventually youll be playing musical chairs anyway  Considering you save  off the comparable Black models Blue is an underdog that you GOT to loveAs others have mentioned in their reviews the average read speeds are quite impressive with the TB WD Blue drives  The only thing it seems to struggle with is random access  Thats because they literally spin up after being idle  It sounds like a mini airplane  Actually its very quiet too  But if you listen close enough you might hear it  Not a big deal but fun to think aboutDo not try to fly this hard drive  It is NOT a vehicleXBOX ONE PEEPS  I recommend the Sabrent external hard drive enclosure  Make sure its the one that supports USB and SATA  It has a fan onoff button and you can hotswap hard drives  The latter I would not recommend due to potential data loss but its cool You can flip the lid and put another hard drive in  Really great if your gaming library is massive and you dont want to go through the process of redownloading stuff all over again  Believe me I understand  I have the worst ISP ever and they charge for data usage  The name sounds like Dom Fast Yup wink

Over the years Ive had many many many hard drives and I found that this one is a little Laggish Several times Ive had to reinstall my operating system because the hard drive failed so Im very glad that I waited to write this review I would definitely not recommend this hard drive

This is a review of this product AND Amazons Customer ServiceProduct Review WD Drives have always treated me great I installed this in my newly built PC as a secondary drive The first product arrived but broke during installation The SATA port on the back was very fragile and broke when I plugged the SATA cable in and yes I was very gentle As a result the pins on the back bent and the motherboard would not recognize the drive I was sad and thought I would have to eat the price This is where the customer service comes insee belowUpdate Since the new drive arrived and was installed it has performed flawlessly Using my USB  external drive I transfered data to this drive at  mbs That is astounding High quality drive Would I recommend it even though my first one broke YesCustomer Service Review When the drive broke I called Western Digital to see what my options were They were very helpful and were willing to replace the drive but they suggested working with Amazon where I purchased the drive because I may receive faster service I agreed to try working with Amazon but if it became a hassle WD agreed to replace the drive So I called Amazon First you should know two things  I am a Prime member and Amazon takes good care of their Prime members and  I live in a suburb of Seattle Amazons headquarters are located in Seattle Anyway I called Amazon around  am and the representative on the phone talked with me about my options He placed me on hold for a minute or two When he came back he said I have some good news we can replace the hard rive for you The new drive should arrive before  pm tonight I was completely astounded My jaw was hanging open I happily thanked the man on the phone and concluded our conversation Before  pm a civilian car not UPS FedEx etc pulled into my driveway and delivered the new HDD ON THE SAME DAY THAT I CALLED You cannot beat that service anywhere Incredible

I now own  of these and they are exactly as expected I use them in a HTPC recording TV and to store other media I have owned one for  month as of  and one for  months I will do my best to update this when oneboth fail though i am highly optimistic because i have only ever had  WD HDD fail on me and it was an external that lasted at least  years in fact I have a WD Blue gb from  and a WD  gb from  in the PC I am writing this onThe price per gb is fantastic for this particular drive I chose it becasue it was the cheapest per gb at time of purchase from a brand I trust as there are few other HDDs you can find for less  per gb  on pcpartpicker as of writing and some of those are refurbished

I think Ill stick with WD Black or Red the next time  This drive doesnt seem to be holding up too well after a short period of use  Lots of errors and some noise not loud but noticeable is a pretty good predictor of total failure in the not too distant future  It crashed my Win  desktop but still passed the WD tests which I thought was pretty interesting  I would not recommend  Spend the extra few  and go with Black Red or their current equivalent

I have a HP Pavilion Elite HPE that I bought back in   This  PC is now six years old  It had two  TB Seagate hard drives that diedWell I decided to use WD hard drives instead  I started off with the new bigger  TB  and  TB they did not work wouldnt install at allThen I had a brainstorm  My computer is just too old for these newer drives So I purposely picked out this one thats  TB just like the original drive that I was replacing and it came out in   That was close enough to the  build date of my HP PC and still be a brand new hard driveWell that worked just like a plug and play device that I would expectI am hoping that this info will save someone a week or two of suffering when trying to do your own repairs

The hard drive came packaged securely Installed it in the computer formatted it and it worked fine I did a full format not a quick format to test for bad sectors and then went to do a chkdisk on it and it told me I didnt have to because I guess it already did during the full format which took like ish hours by the way and it said there were no bad sectors Overall Id say this is a good purchaseI am glad I went with this drive over the WD Black saved a couple of dollars I was worried about the speed of the drive considering I only have an SSD in the system this would be for adding extra games to since my SSD was filled up quite fast No problems loads games just fine Couldnt be happier with this purchase Now I see why so many people choose this driveI guess Ill just come back and add a note to this review if the drive fails on me but Ive been putting it to the test filling it up with games adding files deleting files I think it will last

Based on the large number of positive glowing reviews and my constant need for more space I decided to give this WD a whirl I own  other older WD Blue and  WD Blacks mostly for games and movies After attaching data and power the drive was recognized but wouldnt format even after multiple attempts in Win  The results were usually a nonresponsive system or just an error message I shut down and rebooted this time into Win  Strangely it quick formats after the nd try and seems to be working just fine until I booted up this morning Whatever Win  couldnt recognize when trying to format the drive initially reared its ugly head again and wouldnt let me boot up AT ALL until I completely disconnected the drive Connecting the drive after start up again gave me a nonresponsive system Restart to Win  connect drive and this time it will not recognize any data on the HDD and asks me to format Something is seriously wrong here so Im requesting a replacementWill up date this review when I try the replacementUpdate Never had this much trouble installing a HDD beforeSo I received my replacement pretty quickly props to Amazon Installed the drive in my tower device manager disk management format etc Everything seems to work fine Copy all the files from a dying drive over to the new one with no problems Restart computer and the new drive is nowhere to be found Not in device or disk Nowhere After some trial and error apparently these WD Blues are very picky when it comes to which SATA port theyre connected to Why I havent the slightest clue In summation the drive does work but do I trust it Not really After several more reboots into both Win  and  its showing up and accessible With some reluctance I change my  star to  Time will tell but it feels like a gamble with these drives

This was a replacement for a failed hard drive in a three year old HP desktop  It doubled my capacity  I debated going for a  GB SSD but in the end I went for capacity  Its relatively fast and quiet  One plus year later I have no complaintsAs others have found replacing and installing is almost a snap  The biggest hassle was just pulling that old case out of its rack moving it around and opening it up  And then stuffing the tower back into its rack

I have used a number of these drives over the last few years and have yet to have a problem with one The greatest enemy of a hard drive is off and on cycling That is turning the computer off until it cools and then going through the warm up when it is started again A lot of drives cant hold up to this but I have noticed that this one holds up very well It will eventually fail under cycling just as a light bulb will fail due to the heating and cooling but I think it can hold its own with most any other drive

While not a fast as the WD Black drives this drive is quite capable  Having always had good luck with WD drives I insist on their products for mechanical HDDsOne thing that is very important to me is how this unit was packaged and shipped  The bagged drive was firmly suspended by its ends in a sturdy cardboard box  That box was then packed in the shipping box  Contrast this to how some suppliers one that has yellow eggs on its logo for example ship loose drives in a box of peanuts and Amazon is the way to go  at the same or lower price too

Got this to replace my WD Caviar Green TB drive which is  years old mostly in continuous  hrd use in that time and starting to show some early wear indications on disk health programs no failures indicated though  Ive tried several brands of hard drives over the last  years and have found Western Digital drives to be the most reliable for me  I chose the WD Blue  TB  rpm drive because it was WD ie reliability ease of use support etc all the things WD is known for provides excellent capacity and performance for the price and would be quiet and low power  My current desktop build is nearly absolutely silent which is what I was shooting for when I specd out the components and I wanted to keep it that way  The power and noise levels for the  rpm Blue were much better than alternative  rpm drives  The file operations were already about  faster than my existing Caviar Green unit GBs vs   Since I use the drive in a Maxell hyperduo hybrid configuration paired with an Adata GB SSD my Asus mother board has that feature built in I was not too concerned about speed of file operations  I have all of my programs and the most frequently accessed data files on a  GB SSD I just want the hard drive for media files pictures videos music and less accessed other data  This drive is very quiet and so far is performing well

Looking for a cheap primary hard drive or a secondary hard drive to store games Then this is the hard drive for you Ive owned WD Greens and while they are reliable they are a little slow for my gaming tasteSet up is easy Just plug in power and sata cables and all you need to do is format with Windows Partition Manager I got mine running in seconds The Harddrive is also very quiet unlike my old ones that would make loud spinning noises In addition my games on it run almost as fast as my SSD Loading for me gave me a difference of  seconds at most on most of my games compared to SSD While there are many games that would benefit from SSD this HDD is great for those games that you dont mind too much about It also makes a great boot drive if you dont want to spend on an SSDOverall a well made hard drive that I would highly recommend if you need the space and performance

WD Blue are good drives for the money  I had a TB Seagate Black Armor NAS in my recycling bin that had died a horrible death  I bought one of these WD Blue drives for another system and on a whim I plugged it right out of the box into the BA NAS in place of the original drive  When I powered it on to my amazement the NAS formatted the new drive automatically and it came right up good as new at twice the capacity  Its on my network now  I named it Lazarus

Received the two that I ordered and set them up in RAID   They work great mostly easy setup with Windows   I had tried to set them up the typical way for Win  and it caused problemsIn win  Click Start Icon Right Click on This PC the old My Computer Icon basically click manage and then go to Disk management under storage section  Right click one of the drives and add mirror  Works great  Took me a while to figure that outThe Drives themselves worked fine the performance is as expected  I run my games from the harddrives and my operating system on an SSDI would have preferred TB but I feel  TB is more than enough because I have a TB on the way that will be used non RAID for video storage etcI trust WD to protect my data especially in RAID  Still have some that are  years and kicking

My PC that I built only had an SSD and while it definitely sufficed for a while more and more Steam games required me to purchase a bigger drive I saw this drive for  and took the jump I remember hard drives of the past were very noisy and slow but this drive is neither noisy nor slow I had a power surge trip the motherboard in my computer and everything needed to be reformated on my SSD but amazingly this drive had everything still in tact including all my games which I did not need to download again Im talking more than  gigs and at least a whole days worth of downloading This drive is a winner

This is a great basic hard drive Its a terabyte spins at  RPM and has a  Gbps SATA throughput To top it off its a great price per GB  sure there are drives at higher capacities with lower prices per GB but this is the sweetspot A thumb rule I use to calculate that how much does the next lower capacity cost In this case  GB sells at about  Add  and your capacity doubles to this  TB model Thats  increase in capacity for  increase in price Whenever a Hard drive capacity falls in this rule thats what I define as the budget sweetspotComing back to topic at hand The hard drive arrived in basic but very functional packaging with adequate protection And its working perfectly fine so it living proof that its all good in terms of packaging and handling I unpacked it and installed it into my desktop  a process that took about  minutes end to end I booted up the computer and voila the hard disk was seen Windows initialized it and in matter of seconds I was up an running with this shiny new storage bin for all my games movies and musicIve been a WD user for years after switching over from Seagate due to sheer number of RMAs I had to do with Seagate And once again I am super satisfied with this model Go for it its a great budget hard drive with the optimal capacity based on my formula above

Bare in mind that this review is as of less than a week since I got it so please take it accordingly  If anything odd happens with it Ill come back and update my review  That said heres how things went so farI picked up this drive to replace a  year old Seagate drive that had problems since about two months after I got it  That drive still worked for the most part but had a major issue somewhere past  GB because it would crash all disk tools and the computer if too much was stored on the drive  That was the second bad Seagate in a row  It was only in a DVR repurposed media PC so it was low priority but when I finally got around to it I decided to go with Western Digital  Anecdotally Ive had better luck with them though Ive owned more Seagates over the yearsThe drive came in very adequate packaging which was nice to see  It passed all the check disk tests I threw at it  The sound was quite quiet when I had it outside the PC via a USB connection to clone my old drive  The drive didnt get hot and never made much more than a whisper  I put it in the PC and no issues  The drive is quieter though thats hardly hard given the old one was very loud and hasnt given me any problemsThe real tell for a drive is the first week to month that you have it so Ill keep a close eye on it  However the signs are all looking quite good with it thus far  Im quite happy with the purchase thus far

Over the years I have bought almost every brand of HHD on the market  I keep coming back to Western Digital because they are quality drives and maintain excellent data integrity  Even the lowend WD Blue TB SATA  Gbs  RPM MB Cache  Inch Desktop Hard Drive WDEZEX is a very good choice for the average user like me  Its  PRM makes data retrieval quick and the MB cache keeps frequently used data instantly available  Playback of movies and audio is seamless  Its vast storage capacity allows me to keep many years of pictures archived and ready to view instantly  For my money this is the best desktop HDD for the average computer user

This hard drive model is a good balance between performance and a great price for those looking to upgrade from smaller capacity drives This is my second or third purchase of this particular model and it is performing to my expectationsso far But there are other hard drive models  made by both Western Digital and Seagate  that are sold by third party sellers on Amazons site and fulfilled by Amazon This one is an exception that is sold and shipped directly by Amazon But people need to beware of the unethical practice of some of these sellers due to quality defects and questionable warranty issues They are actually selling used drives that are pulled from working servers and workstations  and are repackaged and resold at suspiciously low prices as new Amazon is fully aware of this practice by these scammers but is doing nothing about them Always do your due diligence by testing ALL hard drives purchased here using tools available on Western Digital and Seagate websites Check for warranties to avoid getting scammed and IMMEDIATELY return any that do not meet stated performance and warranty standards

I was worried about noise problems from reading the other reviews when I ordered this myself Sure enough it happened to me but I found the problem It comes from the hard drives operating frequency creating resonance within the frame of the computer Basically vibrating at a certain frequency that creates lots of noise between the hard drive the and computers case A quick reposition and now I have no excessive noise Other than that runs like any other hard drive

Great value at speed for a basic PC drive  was getting around  MBsec reads and writes with this on my Mac  Very quiet operation makes little noise and generates little heat  Warranty is a bit short but has a good reputation s a solid reliable responsive workhorse  Probably the best value out there right now for a  TB drive  The  TB blues can be had at  rpm like this while higher capacities are slower at

Very fast about  MB reading time per second Light  almost hollow constructionFully operational temperature from   F measured with IR device Huge Cache ram  MB  Its absolutely Silent Worth the price paid to other seller absolutelyNote I purchased the same one from the other retailer online after ordered from Amazon was lost in transitso I cant guarantee that Amazons electronics would be of the same quality

I purchased this hard drive to add to an older Dell desktop computer  The drive is easy to install and works well for my purposes data storage  Be aware that this particular product package contains the hard drive only  There are no instructions SATA cable or screws included for the installation  If you are simply replacing an existing hard drive this should not be an issue  But if you are adding this as a second hard drive you will need to purchase those additional parts  The ones I purchased were StarTech Replacement PC Mounting Screws Long Standoff   Pack SCREW and Monoprice inch SATA Gbps Cable wLocking Latch  Black which worked perfectly  If you are not familiar with how to install a hard drive there are numerous videos and instructions available online that are just a Google search away

Its hard to objectively review these I dont have access to the highend memory testing equipment thatll monitor it spinning at max speed and since its got all my Steam games stored on it Im sure not going to test it to destruction SoTLDR Works great Stable quiet solid construction You get a lot less than TB of space obvs but theres plenty to go around still Its rated for Sata gbs you wont get that except for brief spurts of writing to a SSD HHDs are vastly limited by platter spin and read times The sata power ports are clean and easy to get into a big improvement over the older power ports and IDE cables of yesteryear I wouldnt recommend this as a boot drive compared to an SSD because theres no comparison there But for volume its hard to beat and this is priced at a really competitive point and Western Digitals reputation for great products is wellearned

In retrospect I think I might have gone with Green the quieter cooler but slower line This one is very fast and installed wonderfully but it does add some heat and whine to my previously whisper quiet pc Not to a terrible extent considering my previous pcs hard drive sounded like an airplane when it revved up but for my needs I might have been better off with GreenI say this because it was a significant struggle figuring out the differences Blue is for standard PC needs Good speed but midrange everything Green gives larger capacities quieter cooler more power efficient and slower But probably not to a recognizable amount except by the power users For them though is Black a beast for the hardcore types There are others but those are the only ones the average user need look atBasically this is a quality hard drive just be prepared for a slight whine hardly audible but its an add on to go with my completely silent SSD so any sound is noticeable and a bump in heat no need for alarm but the internal temp in my PC has raised a few degrees so that Im considering adding another fan I complain here but its a good hard drive and you cant do much better than WD especially at this process point

Western digital is a great brand and I have had WD Drives which have functioned for  years  This was after extensive research the best item I could use to back up my critical files I am a photographer  I have redundant backup including the cloud WD has been my goto drive for its reliability This was quiet operated at a cool C temperature even when running as I was imaging my existing disk image to it  Unfortunately I made the mistake of ordering a cable with it It failed within  hours of arrival and this was not the fault of WD Due to current WD models comparable now much more expensive I had to go with a replacement brand which I am unsure of   stars because of me having to return it otherwise  stars for the general product line which is great

per GB at time of purchase Best value under The cheapest RPM TB HDD on AmazonWestern Digital is a quality company and i buy all my HDDs from themPROs Fast or as fast as you could expect a RPM MB Cache drive to be Has not died yet  Will update ifwhen it doesCONs Not rated for NAS storage  use  It will likely be running  so a NAS rating would help ease my mind just not worth an extra This went in a new build for a customer who wanted a Steambox at the lowest possible price without sacrificing capability All purchased on AmazonLenovo ThinkServer TS AHUX i GHz Comes with GB or RAM  WD Blue TB SATA Gbs rpm Internal Hard Drive  EVGA GeForce GT  GB GDDR bit DVIHDMIVGA Low Profile Graphics Card iClever ICRF G Ultra Mini Wireless Keyboard with Mouse Touchpad  Microsoft Xbox  Wireless Controller for WindowsAmazonBasics HighSpeed HDMI Cable   FeetThe build went very smoothlyInstalled Windows  and the Nvidia driver via the included CD that came with the graphics card had to find the Intel network driver online for windows as it was not included with the Lenovo ThinkServerThen installed Linux the Linux binary Nvidia driver and Nvidia kernel from the Debian repositories Network worked out of the box as expected on LinuxAt this point both Windows and Linux where ready for useI personally tested one game using Steam on LinuxMetro Last Light Redux worked great no lag at all on the second to highest graphic settingTo note the Lenovo ThinkServer does NOT come with an operating system none installed no key included or CD for windows My customer already had a copy of Windows  It does come with a server systems installer helper though i did not try using it

The first one of these hard drives I received made a high pitched noise like it had a bad bearing in it so I returned it to Amazon  They sent out a new one and while it makes the same noise it is much quieter than the first one and I can only hear it late at night when theres no other noise going on  So Ive decided to keep this one and see how it goesThis is a fast drive overall  I have an old GB Western Digital Black drive and this new Blue drive beats it in every test except for one of the write tests in DiskMark  Ive been using this drive now as my boot drive and keep all of my games on the old Black drive and my system seems more responsive overall  Also the seek noise is noticeably quieter than my old drive  It also spins up quicker at just over two seconds compared to five seconds for my old driveThe reason I docked it a star is due to the high pitched noise Im happy so far with every other aspect of this drive as far as performance goes  Ill be sure to update this review if anything goes wrong in the future

I connected the drive with an external USB  port StarTech brand and used Macrium Reflect to clone the failing drive in the computer  I left Macrium running while I dealt with a rush customer order on another computer  By the time the order was taken care of hours the clone was done  I swapped this with the old drive and the computer came up with no issues at allThe computer is running Windows  Pro and is used in an office

I dont buy hard drives very often so I must say I was a bit disappointed that it didnt come in a box with a manual and cables and screws So for people who are like me make sure you have the cables and screws to mount this thing or buy some before it shows up

Its amazing how quickly prices for technology decreases while at the same rate that technology is improved Nowhere is that more apparent I think then in the arena of Hard Drives Only a few years ago people were paying top dollar for these TB hard drives I recall a computer build in mid  in which I spent more than a hundred dollars on a HDD that was only GB Now WD offers a TB HDD for only   for TB Nuff said WD dominates the HDD market and offers similar deals on all of their products tooIn this current day and age SSDs are becoming increasingly popular for the rumored edge of HDDs in gaming As far as pricing versus performance is concerned SSDs are still not a very cost effective product HDDs offer QUADRUPLE the storage at half of the price And while a HDD generally will not offer faster PC boot times like an SSD or faster file opening times it is still only  for an HDD with TB and  for a SSD with GB It is worth noting that SSDs do not offer any gaming acceleration either which some gaming enthusiasts mistake The HDD is here to stayThanks WD and Amazon for offering a very cheap component of PC building

Got this drive to replace one that a friend needed for a system that had had the drive removed Ive always found WD drives to be good drive that last a good while In the past Ive never had a problem installing WD drives except when in an older system that had to have the BIOS upgraded This system didnt need that I first installed the drive in the computer and made sure the SATA plugs were well seated and correctly plugged in After this I booted up the system to the BIOS and checked to see if the drive was seen and it was After making sure that all BIOS settings were OK I rebooted and let an install disk for Win  do its job The drive gave me no problems and was fine thru the boot up and installation of the OS I had no problems to this point and expect none I think my friend will be happy Another good drive

Ill have to side with the vast number of reviewers of this hard drive it is excellent Installed in minutes Fast ship BTW Can hardly hear it spinAfter I installed it in our Dell  Optiplex tower I discovered that one of the metal auxilary card slot covers had come loose and may have been contacting  arcing something inside I could smell ozone and was getting hard drive failure messages That is why I bought this drive to begin with ie the Failure  is  Imminent messages I thought maybe the hard drive was frying Anyway after dislodging the wayward cover and going back and checking the old Seagate drive I found the drive is okay Bonus Now I have a spare Im gonna stick with this WD Blue though as it appears to be of higher quality faster and is certainly quieter Lorilou

Item was just what I needed and wanted I had a problem with the first one I was unable to install my operating system on it Amazon immediately replaced it The nd one installed immediately with no problem It appears to be faster than the Seagate just died it replaced Have had both Seagate and WD hard drives and have failures with both over the yearsso cannot say which is better Went with WD this time because both of my last two HD failures were Seagates It is working great and have no problems since installing it Would buy again Could not beat the price for a  TB HD

It has been a while since using WD harddrives since prices were all over the place after the flooding years ago  Quality has also been an issue I was bitten twice by Seagate drives failing for no apparent reason even within their warranty period Decided to go back after a Seagate and Hitachi drive kicked the bucket on me recently I needed a GB RPM drive as passive storage for my music files Went with this one as it has the same specs as the WD Black  So far it is quiet and functions well within my computer  Dont expect anything above TB for the blue seriesyou will have to resort to the Black Red or Green if capacity is the issue

Bought these for a RAID array to run Windows  Absolutely no complaints they are running flawlessly night and day just like WDs have always done for me If you need dependable drives at a reasonable price these get the job done For truly mission critical builds I have used the WD Black or Purple drives with great success  Really get long life out of them running  before ever having any issues Unbeatable for the price  Thats just my opinion but Ive got more than a few of these blues that are well over a year and a half running nonstop day and night still going strong  Hope you have as much success with them as I have

I have had good experiences using Western Digital hard drives This is the second one of these I have bought this year and I would recommend them to anyoneI did have a problem but it was not caused by the drive Western Digitals support is what keeps me going back to them for drives My problem was that after I installed an operating system and rebooted the drive began reporting its size as MB instead of TBI will caution you not to use any drive of TB or larger as a boot drive on Gigabyte motherboards with Qflash There appears to be a glitch that corrupts the volume size information of large hard drivesEven though my new drive is now unusable because of the motherboard in my computer they will replace it under warranty I spent almost  hours on the phone with a rd level technician located in California while we tried different things to repair this drive He was professional and courteousI am very happy with them so I have to let everyone know

WB has never failed me I bought one about  years ago for my first build and now I am using that same HDD as secondary drive on my newest build This one was for my cousins to whom I gave them my old PC and so far they are very happy because they can store many more movies and music plus its much faster which still is very slow to me because SSD so I suggest to use this one as secondary drive and use an SSD instead You wont regret it

Fast installed easily XP service pack  installed flawlessly  THEN malware attacked when trying to get IE  working properlyMalwarebytes  free software download removed the malware from the WD  TB diskIE  worked so badly that we were forced to switch to FirefoxInstalling a new hard drive is easier than trying to get malware off an old diskDesktop now boots fast compared to old drive infected with unwanted hard or impossible to remove softwareOld SATA drive now used as secondary driveSearch for WD TB SATA XP installation for tutorial on WD  TB disk and XP installationLeo Notenboom adds  Malwarebytes I throw Malwarebytes Antimalware into a classification by itself Its not really an antivirus tool per se In their forums youll often see the support staff recommending antivirus tools to install alongside Malwarebytes But I cant really call it an antispyware tool either  Whats important is that it continues to have a very good track record of removing troublesome malware that other packages sometimes miss  Malwarebytes AntiMalware comes in two versions free and pay The free version is a fully functional standalone manual scanner I often recommend it as an additional tool when removing malware or when malware is suspect The paid version adds realtime scanning and scheduled scanning and updates

Ill never give any hard drive a  star rating so lets just have that be said right now  However I will note that I recently lost my c drive on a  year old HP pc and I was pretty impressed that the hard drive lasted that long It was the amazing to me that the pc even lasted that long Granted the pc itself has seen various new parts over the years but the c drive motherboard ram and processor had never needed a replacement until this year I hope that small drives such as TBs and Id rather have had a gb for a c drive never go away They are better imho for a c drive desktop because for keeping your pc in good shape if your the kind of user who knows how to default your storage to other drives on your pc I rarely store anything on my c drive it all goes into other drives Im not the kind of user who uses my documents or anything in the user folder either Its all sent to other drives Ive just lost to many c hard drives in my pc life to not get smart about storage elsewhere I believe that keeping that drive as clean as it was is what made it last so long

I purchased this drive to add more space to a NAS server I was using so I didnt expect much out of drive itself especially concerning speed but overall I was happy with the purchase as the drive performs and pass all SMART checks WD makes some of the most reliable drives in my opinion on the marked so expect the drive to last if not outlast the device you are planning on install this into The packing includes the drive and manual as well as warranty information but not much else so if you are planning on cloning an existing drive to this one I would recommend a USB SATA cable and Paragon Hard Disk Manager to clone the OS or files onto your new drive I will point out that this is a  RPM drive so its marginally faster than your standard  RPM drive and performs well for an OS drive if you arent too concerned with speed as for long term storage this drive provides great transfer speeds and performs above expectation I would recommend this drive to anyone looking to expand storage space or just looking to replace a smaller drive on an existing machine

I was torn between the Blue Red and Blacks Having always unhesitatingly gone for the WD Black this time I already had SSD storage to provide fast immediate storage Did I really need to spend the extra cash on the WD Black line over the Blue I decided to do some researchFirst the RPM speeds Red spin slower somewhere around  while the Blues and Blacks do rpm This makes sense The Reds are meant to go in NAS enclosures which means possibly a few  disks in close proximity The slower speeds generate less heat  which matters more since there are multiple drives and not just a single drive  which helps improve disk conditions and longevity The Blues and Blacks are meant to go in Desktops The Blacks have a  year warranty whereas these Blue only have a  year warranty  year with the Retail kitThe WD Black perform better than the WD Blue line but not by much If you dont already have an SSD and only need one main drive pick a WD Black To be honest the main difference is the warranties previously mentioned The extra cost of the Black ensures you wont have to buy another drive for  extra years Personally I figured I could afford to spend the cost of another WD Blue should it fail after  years so the extra warranty period for the WD Black was not a factor for meThe last thing which helped me pick the Blue line was a Western Digital document which specifically stated that both the Black and Blue drives are fine in Desktop RAID setups  Intel RST LSI HBAs etc  they just arent recommended for NASEnterprise RAID setups I was worried about TLER lack there of and the shorter warranty period but when I realized they could both be put in a RAID setup the difference between these drives became a nonfactorThat said I havent yet turned my drives into a RAID array and am using them in JBOD   Just a Bunch of Disks  mode meaning Im using them much as most people would I can honestly say there isnt a noticeable difference on the user experience side of things on the difference between the WD Black and the WD Blue I highly doubt a user that claims he could blindly tell the difference between the drives

EDIT  I have confirmed with Western Digital that the product images are incorrect This is a singleplatter driveAt the time of purchase this  At the time of this review its down to  The other Blue drives are or wereGB  GB  GB  GB  With the understanding that the greater the data density the higher the sustained data transfer rate this drive is a nobrainer But if youre buying a new HDD to boost the speed of your PC dont It will make little if any difference Also note that SATA  Gbs is a sales gimmick Though anything less in hard drives is almost a thing of the past mechanical hard drives can not reach the speeds provided by the SATA  Gbits or  MBs and SATA  Gbits or  MBs interfaces This drive is rated by WD at  MBs sustained data transfer rate Which aint too shabby for a rotating platterIt arrived very well packaged in a sealed antistatic bag captured by a twopiece molded plastic cradle inside a sturdy sealed cardboard boxThe only problem I had was with Acronis It refused to recognize either this or the old WD drives in my PC Macrium Reflect did the job of cloning my old drive instead Then Windows  expanded the partition to use the full TBOtherwise the drive is quiet but I can just hear it if Im listening for it And it runs luke warm in extended testing

I dont have the numbers in front of me right now but I ran some tests on my hard drive after it was installed to verify that this drive would actually perform as well as the passmark tests said it did Passmark btw is software that tests hardware across many computers and compiles the results to see how well different pieces of hardware perform Anyway this particular hard drive outperformed almost all other hard drives other than the solid state drives of course and was far less expensive than its competitors I was very pleased to find out that it performed just as well as passmark claimed it did from other testersAs to stability since day  this drive has given me no problems Beyond that I have not tested power consumption or heat dissipation Im not that much of an enthusiast I just know it was relatively inexpensive and performed right up there with the best According to passmark the WD Velociraptor only performed about  higher than this drive yet costs four times as much This drive is a real steal for the quality youre getting Besides its got a  year warranty

As noted by nearly everyone else this drive is quiet and relatively fast It is a bare drive youll need a cable probably you have one lying around If you are looking for a drive of this classcapacity for the price I dont see how you could go wrongThat said the warranty is only  years not the greatest but at this price point not the worst either Over the last  or so years in IT Ive seen scores of WD disks and failure from defective materials not wear has been rare Opinions on this of course vary widely but in my experience this brand provides the most reliable consumerclass disk available If you add a redundant configuration its hard to imagine a disaster scenario ever occurring perhaps an electrical surge or something  but thats not the disks fault and the truly wary will also have a backup on external media to mitigate against it For those who insist on using only one disk for their data be mindful that you are putting the data at needless risk disks are so cheap these days no matter what brand you selectRegarding the packaging in my case it was first rate a separate box the drive was shipped with other stuff with proper antistatic bag and snugly fitted end caps tightly braced against the walls absolutely zero room for movement Frankly retail packaging is no better and sometimes worse

Got this to replace my WD Caviar Green TB drive which is  years old mostly in continuous  hrd use in that time and starting to show some early wear indications on disk health programs no failures indicated though  Ive tried several brands of hard drives over the last  years and have found Western Digital drives to be the most reliable for me  I chose the WD Blue  TB  rpm drive because it was WD ie reliability ease of use support etc all the things WD is known for provides excellent capacity and performance for the price and would be quiet and low power  My current desktop build is nearly absolutely silent which is what I was shooting for when I specd out the components and I wanted to keep it that way  The power and noise levels for the  rpm Blue were much better than alternative  rpm drives  The file operations were already about  faster than my existing Caviar Green unit GBs vs   Since I use the drive in a Maxell hyperduo hybrid configuration paired with an Adata GB SSD my Asus mother board has that feature built in I was not too concerned about speed of file operations  I have all of my programs and the most frequently accessed data files on a  GB SSD I just want the hard drive for media files pictures videos music and less accessed other data  This drive is very quiet and so far is performing well

This drive is not plug and play with my Dell Inspiron  with Windows  Pro Heres how I got the drive to workFirst off the drive comes with no cable or mounting screws  I had to separately purchase a  pin SATA cable compatible with SATA II  Get a cable with a least one of the connectors on it being straight rather than right angle because a right angle might block an adjacent SATA receptacle on the motherboardSecond get some mounting screws I had some laying around so I didnt buy them and thus cannot give you the size or length  Suffice to say they are the same screws that are standard for most tower casesFYI if youve installed IDE drives in the past you may recall having to set jumpers to specify whether the drive is primary or slave No jumpers required with this SATA driveOkay on with the installation  After plugging the drive into the power cable and SATA cable i turned the machine on  After it fully started up and I logged in I waited awhile and finally got a message saying something like new device installedThen I rebooted the computer and during the reboot I hit F so i could access the CMOS Utility screen  One of the options on that screen allowed me to look at the hard disc drives HDD  I did that to confirm that the computer in fact saw a drive was connected  I did not change any settings and simply exited the utility and proceeded to full start up of the pc  This step is probably optional since youll access the drive status in the Disc Management step belowI then opened windows explorer and prayed that the drive appeared  Alas it did not  Thats because the drive still had to be initialized partitioned and formattedTo do those steps access Administrative Tools in Control Panel by going to Start selecting Control Panel and then in the Control Panel windows top right corner type Administrative Tools and hit the search magnifying glass icon  From Administrative Tools go to Computer Management  Storage  Disc Management  Fyi when i clicked Computer Management i had to wait awhile while the computer accessed something called a snapin I also had to wait awhile after clicking Disc Management for the system to find the data it needed regarding the status of the discsIn Disc Management you should see all your hard disk drives listed My preexisting hard disk is listed as Disc   The new disk is listed as Disc   I was automatically prompted to initialize  Disc   After initializing it the disc is listed as having unallocated storageRightclick inside the black strip representing the unallocated storage space and select New Simple Volume  A wizard will then walk you through formatting and partitioning the disc and assigning it a drive letter and assigning the drive a name of your choosing  I chose to use NTFS as the formatting system and not to partition it into multiple partitionsIm not anywhere close to a computer expert so I dont know if this was the best way to get the job done but it seems to be working out fine for me  Hope this helps you all

Okay I know some people think they should only review the product in this space I bought this HDD for a friends PC The first one was DOA and the second one works just fine You really cant review a hard drive unless you have used it for a while anyway I think  That figured into my purchase of this drive which has a twoyear warranty compared to the more common practice  recently of manufacturers providing only a oneyear warranty Yeah it is quiet I dont have it connected to SATA III so I cant comment on its potential max throughputNow I waited  days to install the drive Many many many online and brickandmortar hard drive vendors only offer  day DOA return on PCparts I immediately went to my Amazon account clicked return and saw I beat the deadline by one day The drive made a screeching noise very loud and smelled like electrical burning It even worked for about  seconds before that happened Twice And then my monitor went all fritzy No way did I want that drive and no way did I want to mess around with the manufacturer With Amazon  click click and click I instantly printed a free prepaid return label and got my new drive in less than  hours  thank you Amazon for Amazon Prime So yeah the  day return period and the simplicity of return makes Amazon number one in hard drives and a lot of other things where a certain percentage are going to be DOA Nothing bad about Western Digital I am sure it couldve been a Seagate If anyone is still reading these reviews after about  I am curious have you ever installed a hard drive that made a burning electrical smell out of the box I just thought that was really weird The packaging was perfect Industrystandard static bag suspension ends sturdy cardboard box

I had to decide whether to buy a SSD for my new computer or a hard drive  After reading considerable material on SSDs I came to the conclusion that for most users an SSD is simply a waste of money  A TB SSD will cost almost as much as a new computer  A smaller one that often is used for OS boot up is also a waste This drive boots my Windows  OS is less than  seconds  Is an SSD going to make that  second The new hard drives are extremely fast  very reliable inexpensive and quiet  People should evaluate the need for the SSD before making a purchase You should also realize that the specs provided by SSD makers are not standardized and the performance realized will not necessarily match the specs  Anyway I recommend getting a hard drive

Im an IT neophyte having seen the inside of a computer only a handful of times  My hard drive on a  iMac finally decided to call it quits after nearly  years and a popular fix it website for macs directed me to this drive but at almost twice the price as found on amazon  Debated just buying a new computer but Ive never had an issue with my current iMac and have no need for the latest and greatest  So placed the order also purchased upgraded RAM and three days later Im taking apart an iMac and installing a new drive and RAM  It wasnt simple but far from difficult  Hardest part was finding the right size screwdrivers to take apart the computer and also pulling the glass off the iMac without a suction cup didnt feel lke driving to the store and youtube showed me how to use packing tape to do the jobNot that any would be expected this early but no issues whatsoever with the drive nearly a month later  Seems fast enough slightly more so than before and is very quiet Much more so than the previous drive which admittedly was at the end of its lifeFor the price seems like this was a steal for me  No need to buy a new computer This drive just gave me a new one for th of the price

I purchase this because at the time the new Black drives werent out yet Purchase the Black drive over thisI have this running my operating systems  Buy  TB and only partition  and split that into two smaller chunks and place one operating system in one partition and another in the second or use the second for windows cache or a temp storage  This will give you faster performance overall for a nonSSD diskBuy the Black drive over this one If the black drive is not available then this is a very good drive but a little less speed and performance compared to the BlackWhen purchasing a Hard Drive buy the Retail Kit over the OEM drive for two reasons  You get the extra parts for installation if you dont have them and  OEM drives do at times get warranty denied due to being OEM this means the manufacturer puts it on the supplier such as Amazon to deal with the warranty and Amazon wont so Buy Retail Kit to  be covered under warrantyWhy buy OEM  Price is generally cheaper and you only get the bare drive and no extras including the fancy boxWhy buy Retail Kit  You get the fancy box AND you are for sure covered under Warranty No hassles

Bought one of these a year ago and then another one on Christmas of  The low price is always attractive but do yourself a favor and pass on this one and go with one that has less rate of failureOne day recently my computer kept on throwing the blue screen After much frustration just trying to get it to run my first impression was a virus so I spend a few days doing continuous virus scans Well those scans came up clean but the system continued to bluescreen and then run extremely slow when it would start so after some log checking and digging I got numerious errors of files  tasks missingSo On to disk check for hours which revealed numerous bad sectors Then it was to WDC website to download their support tools and after an extended SMART test  the drive has too many bad sectors and failed the test I have yet to test the second EZE drive that I use as a backupThese drives come in a brown cardboard box  NOT a factory sealed package so trying to get RMA is useless and youll be out your moneyAgain do yourself a favor  avoid the headache and risk of data loss and go with something that has better results Youll spend more money for it but if the rate of failure is low and it will last longer than  year  its much better than backing up reinstalling restoring recovering resaving passwords updating reconfiguring etc etc

I bought a WD blue ezex drive new on August  After  months of use as a storage device for all of my pc games the drive would start showing up as uninitialized intermittently while booting to windows I dealt with it for a while thinking it could be the Sata connections on my motherboard When I upgraded to skylake I found this was not the issue so I RMAd the drive back to WD losing money on shipping They sent me back a refurbished ezex drive that worked decently well for about  more months The drive then started having the same initialization issues on boot up so I sent it back to WDWD offered me an upgrade to a WD black drive What they didnt tell me was that the Black drive they are sending me is a  model number and is slower than the drive I initially bought and though I am still waiting for it I am halfexpecting it to be refurbished and only last another  months I am currently using a refurbished seagate barracuda g drive from an HP windows vista computer from many years ago and it is noisy but working reliably How is it that an  year old seagate drive from a windows vista computer has worked reliably for  years And why have I had  WD blue drives that have lasted less than  months Hopefully this WD Black drive is suitable compensation for these issues because it is starting to feel like my WD drives have spent more time in the mail than in my computer functioning correctly

Im an IT neophyte having seen the inside of a computer only a handful of times  My hard drive on a  iMac finally decided to call it quits after nearly  years and a popular fix it website for macs directed me to this drive but at almost twice the price as found on amazon  Debated just buying a new computer but Ive never had an issue with my current iMac and have no need for the latest and greatest  So placed the order also purchased upgraded RAM and three days later Im taking apart an iMac and installing a new drive and RAM  It wasnt simple but far from difficult  Hardest part was finding the right size screwdrivers to take apart the computer and also pulling the glass off the iMac without a suction cup didnt feel lke driving to the store and youtube showed me how to use packing tape to do the jobNot that any would be expected this early but no issues whatsoever with the drive nearly a month later  Seems fast enough slightly more so than before and is very quiet Much more so than the previous drive which admittedly was at the end of its lifeFor the price seems like this was a steal for me  No need to buy a new computer This drive just gave me a new one for th of the price

This particular drive I first purchased one that that didnt work returned it to Amazon for the  day guarantee and was sent a new one This next one died in  months Would read and write but was very slow until it stopped communicating altogether with my motherboardSince it was out of the Amazon Guarantee I tried the RMA at that point with Western Digital I wasted almost  dollars on packaging and finding and buying an antistatic hard drive bag and paying for THEIR UPS label from the Western Digital website only to have it marked as damaged I have no idea what happened I packed it well and the drive was not physically damaged it just would not work They didnt update their site or communicate any of this to me without me having to call so it has just been sitting in their warehouse for two months I was better off just tossing the drive out before even starting the RMAAwful customer service if you have confidence with WD because of their generous RMAs well think again because it looks like they will find any reason to fault you and you will not have the warranty you expected This is definitely not the first problem I have had with a WD hard drive but its usually within  days that I realize something is wrong When a hard drive dies within months you really take a risk with Western Digital

I bought two of these drives  I purchased the first drive in September to replace a Seagate drive which had begun to fail after six years  This Western Digital failed after only three and a half months  The drive would boot but it developed numerous bad sectors which among other things prevented Windows from installing any system updates I replaced it with a second one in February  That drive set a record for the fastest drive failure I have ever seen since I built my first computer back in  no such thing as hard drives back then it died in only two weeks This was a more serious failure After only two weeks it would not recognize any files would not allow reformatting and Windows said it cold not write to the drive to repair or reinstall Windows These were my first and last Western Digital drives  I always avoided them in the past as WD has always had a reputation of being the blue light special of hard drives  I should have listened to myself  I got smart and bought another Seagate and expect to spend many happy years with it  The Seagate performs beautifully file transfers are faster as are readwrite times  I plan to add a second Seagate drive this month and will never waste another dime on Western Digital garbage

I purchase this because at the time the new Black drives werent out yet Purchase the Black drive over thisI have this running my operating systems  Buy  TB and only partition  and split that into two smaller chunks and place one operating system in one partition and another in the second or use the second for windows cache or a temp storage  This will give you faster performance overall for a nonSSD diskBuy the Black drive over this one If the black drive is not available then this is a very good drive but a little less speed and performance compared to the BlackWhen purchasing a Hard Drive buy the Retail Kit over the OEM drive for two reasons  You get the extra parts for installation if you dont have them and  OEM drives do at times get warranty denied due to being OEM this means the manufacturer puts it on the supplier such as Amazon to deal with the warranty and Amazon wont so Buy Retail Kit to  be covered under warrantyWhy buy OEM  Price is generally cheaper and you only get the bare drive and no extras including the fancy boxWhy buy Retail Kit  You get the fancy box AND you are for sure covered under Warranty No hassles
